Reviews.Title: “Very Quaint Hotel”
Reviews.Author: crackers1
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful older hotel in a great location. It is right by Civic Plaza and the Symphony. Convenient to all San Francisco sights. The hotel is very well maintained and service is excellent. Our room had a frig, microwave and coffee maker. Breakfast is free and excellent! This was our 2nd stay and we would not hesitate to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Charming”
Reviews.Author: cathy N
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful place with such a great location!!! Everyone was exceptionally helpful and the restaurant there was terrific for a nice meal prior to going to an event at Davies Symphony hall. Room was small but well equipped. We definitely recommend it!!

Reviews.Title: “Affordable boutique hotel - very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: frochel
Reviews.Content: I have been to San Francisco before so was happy to be in a location that was further from some of the main sights and close to lovely and quirky neighborhoods. It would be perfect if you were going to the theatre, ballet, opera, classical music concert, etc. And you can walk from there to any of the main sights. Inn at the Opera was very comfortable. I stayed in a small room "Ballet Suite" but knew it would be small when I booked and it was cheaper than the larger rooms. I was travelling alone and anyway don't tend to spend much time in the room so the size was perfectly adequate for my needs. The bed was comfortable, the bathroom clean, there was information in the room and great service. Complimentary continental breakfast was a great bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Really Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: GrandadCheshire
Reviews.Content: We stayed seven nights in total at Inn At the Opera and enjoyed it immensely. It is very handy for downtown (use no5 bus or F line tram). Next to City Hall, Opera House etc so also quiet. Very good restaurants in Hayes Valley a few hundred yards away. All of the staff were very helpful (especially Betty who got hot water and teabags for us so we could enjoy our morning cup of tea!). The restaurant was especially welcome when we arrived after a ten - hour flight. We will certainly stay there again on our next visit!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay when visiting San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: rick b
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 or 6 nights at Inn at the Opera with wife and 2 kids, ages 9 & 12. Rooms were very comfortable, clean and cozy. Beautiful old building, lots of character that you don't get at a new hotel. Great location, easy to walk to many interesting sites, restaurants, shops. Easy to get to wharf and other attractions. Staff was great, very helpful and friendly. Not a bit of pretentiousness. We drove to town in big vehicle, no problem with parking etc. Staff took great care parking and getting our car for us when we would head out for Muir woods or wharf, etc. Very nice breakfast in the morning, setting is elegant, food and service very good. Will definitely stay here again when we next visit San Fran.

Reviews.Title: “SO nice!”
Reviews.Author: Betty S
Reviews.Content: This is a perfect place to stay if you're going to the opera, symphony, ballet or Asian Art Museum. It isn't the Marriott -- it has a bit of character and a European feel. We were in the smallest room but didn't feel crowded and had everything we needed. The staff was exceptionally welcoming, efficient and helpful. Though they were busy because the hotel was fully booked they truly went the extra mile to make our stay enjoyable. Our room was quiet and clean. We'll definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Great location - close to the best Opera or ballet”
Reviews.Author: rrogster
Reviews.Content: The reason for our visit to San Francisco was to see the Romeo and Juliet Ballet in a world class venue. This hotel is practically across the street from that location in an excellent and untouristy part of the city. We had booked a suite and were very pleased with what we received. Our suite was situated on the top floor in the back. Most importantly we had real privacy and quiet. There was no one above us and there were no common walls with any other rooms. Great! We had 2 complete and roomy bathrooms and 2 flat screen tv's. There was a large entry foyer from which one could enter either the bedroom suite or through french doors connecting to a separate living room with its own complete bath. The king bed was very comfy. I like to stay up late and my wife likes to go to bed early. I respect her quiet time so it is important that I not disturb her. With the great floor plan she wasn't bothered at all. There was a small kitchenette with frig as well. Everything from the carpets to the bathroom fixtures were clean and of good quality. Nothing showed signs of wear. The included breakfast was continental in style, typically adequate but not gourmet, served in a beautiful wood paneled dining room. The coffee was excellent. Old world and very classy with an art and musical feel. It was our impression that most of the other clients staying here are elder, sophisticated and well traveled. You won't be finding any bumbling and rude tourists at this location. They'd never find it. We booked a limo from the airport through the hotel staff and it was great as well; very professional and courteous treatment. I checked and the price was only about $5 more than for a taxi from SFO to the hotel. We'll do exactly the same thing next time. The price from SFO was $45. Its only a couple of blocks to Market Street where you can hop on the "F" Trolley. It will take you all the way to the historic clock tower or anywhere inbetween for just $2, or 75 cents if you're a senior or close to it. These trollies are restored and were built in the 40's. A great feel and ride. Mostly locals take it. Just take exact change and pay onboard. It was important for us that this hotel is practically across the street from the War Memorial Opera House where one can see the best Ballet and Opera the west coast of the US has to offer. The website for the Ballet is: www.sfballet.org. All in all a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: lizcarr78
Reviews.Content: One of those small boutique hotels with character that you mostly see in Europe. The rooms are not huge but comfortable enough and clean. I loved the area in spite of it being a little off the beaten path - well connected with public transportation though, no need to rent a car - actually it's less hassle to get around with pub transport. The staff was very welcoming and accommodating. The complimentary breakfast was just fine. It is not a five star hotel but definitely ticks all the boxes for what you pay. No complaints whatsoever.

Reviews.Title: “Small gem off the beaten path”
Reviews.Author: nealwBoston
Reviews.Content: Inn at the Opera is a small, boutique hotel located off the beaten path in San Francisco. I visit San Francisco every couple of years for business and I've stayed at various hotels near the Moscone Center, on Nob Hill and near the major shopping areas. Inn at the Opera is located in an interesting part of the city that I never knew about. It's near the regal San Francisco Opera House, the majestic San Francisco Symphony, the ballet, city hall, a chinese cultural museum; all these building surrounding a grand plaza. If you walk out of the hotel and look to the right, you're staring at the Opera House, but I don't think the fat lady stays at Inn at the Opera. More like ballerinas. In other words, the single rooms are small. Mine had a nice, comfortable bed, no real bureau, other than a couple of shelves in a tiny closet, and a small work table. One nice touch: a microwave, refrigerator and some dishes and silverware. The white-tiled bathroom was actually spacious, compared to the room itself. Everything worked, free Internet, friendly staff, chocolates on your pillow everyday, funky little elevator. In other words, Inn at the Opera is a nice alternative to the larger hotels. For $129 a night, it can't be beat. There's a continental breakfast served in a room that doubles as the Ovations restaurant at night. The breakfast was okay; bagels, muffins, spreads, coffee, tea, hard-boiled eggs, cereal. One little quirky thing -- apparently the electrical system can't handle two toasters going at the same time, so we all had to coordinate our bagel toasting so as to not blow the power strip. Other than that minor quirk, Inn at the Opera is a great choice, as long as you're okay with not being in the thick of the action. Oh, and there are a ton of interesting restaurants on the next street over -- Hayes Street, which cater to the symphony crowd. I ate at Hayes Street Grill one night and it was excellent. I

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place, fantastic staff”
Reviews.Author: judy g
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 5 nights at the Inn at the Opera and had a wonderful time. We had an Opera suite which gave us a master bedroom, 2 full bathrooms, small kitchen and eating area and a separate roomn with a pull-out sofa which would accommodate 2 more people. A complimentary breakfast of fruit, bagels, cereal, yogurt and coffee was offered every morning in the elegant restaurant complete with perfect service - a wonderful way to start a day of exploring San Francisco. Everyone at the hotel went out of their way to be friendly and helpful and made us feel especially welcome. Our only concern was the location which is a hike to places like Union Square, Chinatown and North Beach. We did walk to those areas a few timnes, but we were also able to catch the trolley that runs down Market to the Wharf area and makes getting around so easy. It's a deal for $2 one way but even better for us seniors who pay only $.75. The surrounding Hayes Valley neighborhood is lively and full of fun shops and great restaurants. We were very pleased with our first stay at the Inn and plan to return and tell our friends about this great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Second Visit--Just as good as the first!”
Reviews.Author: GinnyAlamo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Inn at the Opera for a second time and enjoyed our second time just as much (or maybe even a bit more) than our first visit. We spent five nights in an Opera room this time--Room 74 to be exact. It had one-bedroom, a living room with a sofa-bed, a mini kitchen area and two full bathrooms! Both the bedroom and living rooms had updated televisions. Of course your complimentary continental breakfast is always included at no charge. The staff at inn at the Opera are wonderful! Not only do we enjoy staying at this property because we enjoy the property itself, but we love the Hayes Valley area. There are so many great restaurants and bars all within a short walk from Inn at the Opera. This time we took the public buses literally everywhere instead of taking BART. We are going to the symphony in May and have another reservation to spend the night again! If you're looking for a modern hotel, this is not your place. If you're looking for a very comfortable, clean hotel with very friendly staff, this is your place!

Reviews.Title: “Cozy”
Reviews.Author: syrdavid923
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I were in San Francisco, and most of our business was around City Hall. The perfect place? Inn at the Opera. It's small. Yes. It's old. Yes. It's comfortable. Yes The staff is wonderful, attendant to one's every need. From the warm greeting when you arrive to the farewell when you leave, you feel genuine warmth. We liked it. And the price is nice, too.

Reviews.Title: “still the best!!!!”
Reviews.Author: traveltoutesuite
Reviews.Content: one would think that sometimes over time, hotels would lose their appeal. well, inn at the opera is not that hotel. the moment you arrive you are greeted like an old friend. the front end people (Evita, Alex, etc) are incredibly efficient. the rooms are clean, upgrades are continuing, the housekeeping staff (Betty, Maria) always are available to you and the breakfast dining is adding new items. The Asst. GM Sean and Javier the front end manager, are so accomodating one almost feels like the welcomed long lost cousin. the convenience of being steps from the opera house or symphony hall are the main allure. but do not forget it is also only a feet feet more to the asian art museum and some lovely restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “First Class Lodging In Historic San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: Cami F
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Inn at the Opera from Feb 3 to Feb 10 and had the most plesant surprise. The accomodiations while small were lovely and the staff at the hotel were nothing less than welcoming and hospital and very service orientated. We were even more surprised to find the Inn included a complementary contintenial breakfeast with the room, apples and cookies in the afternoon and of course a coffee maker in the room with a small fridge. They also have the loveliest restaurant on the premises. First rate in fact. AND it is located in right off Van Ness Avenue. Public transportation is right on your doorstep making it easy to access Union Square, Market Street Shopping, the Warf and tons of theaters. I am already thinking about going for another week and will certainly make the Inn at the Opera a central part of that trip.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful Elegant Inn”
Reviews.Author: Jo Jo P
Reviews.Content: In a crazy city this was a piece of heaven. It was stepping back in time to a Victorian era filled with gracious service and elegance with the modern convenience of wifi. I loved my room - I almost expected to see a butler step in! Von at the front desk anticipated my needs even before I thought to ask - he even printed my boarding pass for me - such a delightful young man. The bell man would not take a tip! This place was amazing. It was pristine clean. I loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Thoughtfull service”
Reviews.Author: Kathy417
Reviews.Content: Old style charm with all the conveniences. We arrived early. Our room was cleaned & made available to us with only a 20 minute wait. We slept great with no distracting noise from other guests or outside noise. The hotel is close to the wharf, museums, the opera, & much more. We walked most places or hopped on the bus, trolley or cable car.

Reviews.Title: “Almost great”
Reviews.Author: Hanssprungfeld
Reviews.Content: It's a really nice old style hotel full of character, great helpful staff and ideally located. The only problems I had though were fairly big ones. One, the room is very small, two, the Walls are so thin you can hear people talking in the other rooms and constant doors slamming (think they need something on the doors to stop them swinging shut so hard) and third, it might sound petty but the bed squeaked all the time. Every time I turned over in the night it squeaked and woke me up. Didn't sleep well here but it is a really nice place.

Reviews.Title: “Neat little place to stay -- full of charm”
Reviews.Author: Ray T
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a couple nights while in San Francisco. It was so convenient to so much, and far less expensive than places close to the wharf. Next door to museums, the opera, performing arts center, city hall, and more. Walk a few blocks and catch the cable car to the wharf and chinatown and such -- only $2. It's close to Hayes Valley area -- a must to visit for the outstanding food and shops. Stelline's is a very genuine small Italian restaurant with GREAT food and GREAT value. Also, the Boxing Room was super. Would eat at both of them again without pause. Too many places to list. And it's only two blocks away! The Inn at the Opera was wonderful - small charming rooms, but with enough space to relax. It was a bit of stepping back in time, with a charming little elevator that somehow is never slow. Old time open staircase all the way to the 7th floor. Nice complimentary breakfast in the morning. Excellent, friendly, warm, and attentive staff. More than the usual amount of coffee available in the room, in a standard-size coffee maker. Frig. We will undoubtedly return.

Reviews.Title: “More pros than cons”
Reviews.Author: scnertho
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights in late January. Overall the hotel itself was OK - the staff were excellent though. Pros first - as above, the staff were very attentive and nothing was too much trouble for them; rooms were neat and clean and bed was comfortable; choice of cable tv channels also good. Breakfast was decent for a continental, I ended up just having cereal most days but there was also fruit, bagels, muffins etc. Location (near city hall, opera district) was OK...HOWEVER, if you venture too far on the other side of city hall you skirt very close to the Tenderloin area and the dodgy area of Market St...the area around the hotel itself is quite nice (some good restaurants on Hayes St) but if you venture a block or two in the wrong direction it can start to get quite seedy and, well, a bit scary at times...but hey, that's just what you have to expect in a big city, and particularly in SF. Our room (Ballet room) was small, as mentioned in previous reviews, but it was perfectly fine as we were only really there to sleep. Hotel is old but it is still very charming. One tip - take the 'hop on hop off' bus tour that stops right across the street from the hotel - great way to see the city without having to worry too much about wandering into a dubious area! Overall I think I would definitely give this place a go again - good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome for the price”
Reviews.Author: MEK-21
Reviews.Content: I have to warn that the small rooms are small...but for the price in San Francisco this is a great location and very clean. I feel like ladies in big dresses will come around the corner at any time...great atmosphere and the staff is over the top with excellent service. We stay here every year for the opening of the Ballet Season Gala and love being able to walk home. This year we got a suite and LOVED it! Was very big and well worth the points! I would recomend this place to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Quaint setting, great continental breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Bobkido
Reviews.Content: Right in the heart of downtown. Walking distance to a lot of restaurants. Close to the BART lines. Smallish rooms, but well kept. Mini kitchen. Would definitely stay there next time in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy Inn”
Reviews.Author: FedorLeMont
Reviews.Content: An old fashioned hotel/inn some 150 yards away from the SF Opera. Very charming reception with apples and cookies, bringing the luggage to our room and refusing a tip. Rooms old fashioned but cosy. Elegant restaurant, visited by many elegantly dressed opera goers. Reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and made us feel at home”
Reviews.Author: pk155
Reviews.Content: A great boutique hotel. Our room was a little on the smaller side based on other hotel rooms I've stayed in, but I didn't see any of the other rooms at the Inn to compare. I stayed with my youngster daughter, and it was perfectly cozy. The elevator broke down the first night we were there, and this was about 8pm at night. We had to walk up 6 (small) flights of stairs which wasn't that big of a deal. I remember thinking they probably wouldn't have it fixed until the following afternoon or so, but lo and behold it was fixed the following morning. Their front desk staff as well as the dining room staff were all very friendly. Front desk staff in particular were on their toes, pleasant, and made us feel at home. We ate their continental breakfast and a dinner one night, and were very happy with the quality of the food. Walls were a little thin, but nothing close to unbearable. They put us in a room right next to the (small 4 person) elevator, which was a non-issue as well. Communication via email was excellent leading up to our arrival. There are some stores and a few restaurants in walking distance to nearby Hayes Street, although I did get some feedback from locals that the area could be a little "sketchy" at times (we had no issues). The parking was $25/night which is a little pricey for my taste, but is definitely the going rate in SF. You can try to find street parking across from the hotel if you're lucky (but be sure to ask about street cleaning days). There are no kid specific activities or areas, but if you're a parent traveling with kids my guess is that you'll already be plenty prepared with things brought from home to keep them occupied. :) Nothing fancy, but the little things they did made our stay enjoyable. Overall a great bargain for this charming hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing suite!”
Reviews.Author: cool-dictator
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the Inn at the Opera before since we are Shell Vacation members, but this is the first time we've stayed in the deluxe 1 room suite (or "Opera" suite). Since we had our 2 small kids with us, it was PERFECT! It was basically a 2 bedroom/2 bathroom suite, but instead of a bed in 1 room, it was a sofabed. Wonderful for the kids. Our 2 night, 3 day stay could have been so much longer since we had free continental breakfast every morning & a small fridge & microwave in our room with dishes & sink to help us with simple meals. The room was clean & well appointed. Since it's an older building, they have space heaters to warm the building instead of central heating like a modern hotel. Not a bother though since it gives it a boutique feel. The bed mattresses were perfect. I usually have trouble sleeping the first night at most hotels but the first night at the Inn at the Opera, I fell asleep like I was in my own bed! We were treated with smiles by each staff member we met. I felt valued. We will be back & we'll tell our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: FlorabelleVacaville
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at this hotel which is part of our timeshare. Both days we took cabs to go to our destinations. The front desk summoned cabs with amazing promptness. We were pleasantly surprised to be upgraded to a suite which was quite spacious for a room in San Francisco. The hotel was very quiet and nice. The furnishing and decorations were quite appropriate for the holiday season. The breakfast provided each morning in the downstairs restaurant had variety and the servers were very attentive to our needs. The only problem we encountered was the heating system was not operating properly. We had to use space heaters to take the chill off of the room. When we plugged both heaters in, we blew a circuit which after a call to the front desk was quickly fixed. I think our next visit there will be in warmer weather.

Reviews.Title: “Inn at the Opera”
Reviews.Author: Kimberly S
Reviews.Content: If you love history and the genteel ways of the past, then you will certainly enjoy your stay at the Inn at the Opera. From the gentle creak of the wooden floors in the lobby to the small old-fashioned elevator, there's much to appreciate. Although, I would have preferred a slightly larger bed, our suite was spacious, as was the bathroom. The staff was both courteous and kind. One morning during our stay, I was not feeling well and the staff helped my fiancÃ© get some breakfast together on a tray to bring to our room. Definitely will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “romantic weekend getaway”
Reviews.Author: merri352
Reviews.Content: we spent 3 days there on our way to Lake Tahoe for a week. Rooms are small- even in the suites, but very comfortable and excellent service. Walking distance to everywhere- and close to transportation centers for everything else. Breakfast was better than expected.

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming Staff and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Cekg310
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Inn at the Opera a few days before Christmas to see The Nutcracker at the War Memorial Opera House. We could not have chosen a better location! If you are going to the Opera House, this is the place to stay. There's a great restaurant downstairs (if more expensive than the room rates would imply), and complimentary continental breakfast there from 7-10 a.m. We stayed in the Ballet Room and I expected a small, cramped room, but they work with the 215 square feet very well. We were impressed with the kitchenette, which was fully stocked with silverware, glasses, plates and bowls. The room was very clean and quiet. But the service was the aspect that made me give this inn an excellent rating. They were the most courteous hotel staff I have ever come across, saying welcome several times, being utterly respectful at all times when coming to the room, etc. Overall, a great stay and we look forward to coming back!

Reviews.Title: “hotel”
Reviews.Author: kalagapp
Reviews.Content: This beautiful quaint hotel is a must! A very well maintained gem that is moderately priced and accessible to most of San Francisco. The restaurants in the area are wonderful. This hotel is a favorite!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to Symphony Hall”
Reviews.Author: JandR711
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this little hotel for the 1st time as we attended 2 SF Symphony concerts. We stayed in a mini suite--even so, small, but clean and comfortable. Location near symphony hall was a real plus for us. Front desk and bell staff very friendly and helpful. Our room was very quiet as it backed to the alley between the hotel and the ballet school. The hotel could use a little renovation - wallpaper was peeling in the bathroom and old scratched furniture, but our bed was comfortable. Good value for the city. Reminded us of some small hotels we have stayed in in Europe.

Reviews.Title: “Revisiting San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: Roadies2011
Reviews.Content: We had a week to visit old friends and revisit our favorite places in the City. The Inn was a perfect place for this. The staff was outstanding and made every effort to make our stay comfortable and enjoyable--from checking in to the warm cookies in the afternoon. Very charming place to stay. The restaurant is lovely and comfortable. The menu is impressive and the continental breakfast is a perfect touch. Would definitely recommend it as a romantic getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Like being HOME!”
Reviews.Author: mimivan
Reviews.Content: This gem is near Hayes Valley, and close to shopping, muni stops and in a quiet neighborhood. Our stay was enhanced by the friendliest staff we have ever encountered. From the manager to the front desk staff to the cleaning crew and car parker, everyone greeted us, made sure we knew their name and offered to help in any way they could. The rooms are small but cozy and clean. We recommend this lovely spot for anyone who wants to be centrally located, near the opera and symphony and muni that can get you anywhere you want to go within minutes for $2. No need for a car in this city!!!

Reviews.Title: “Daily large breakfast, good location, friendly staff, worn out beds”
Reviews.Author: spunkykvf
Reviews.Content: We reserved a mid-November week at Inn at the Opera on Fulton Street in San Francisco, 1 block from the renovated City Hall, the SF War Memorial, the Opera House, & the Louise Davies Symphony Hall. There are many restaurants right around the corner, & public transportation is just a few blocks away. It is an older hotel w/mostly timeshare units. There are 7 stories w/an elevator that takes 4 max & carpeted stairs directly from the lobby. The front lobby area has room to sit & relax for both hotel & restaurant guests. There are a limited number of complimentary local newspapers available early in the morning; cookies from Subways occasionally offered mid-afternoon, & nightly chocolates for the evening turndown service. The restaurant is in the back & serves a complimentary buffet breakfast for hotel guests (fresh fruit, toast/bagels w/cream cheese, butter, & jam, hard-boiled eggs, Subway sweet muffins, milk, water, oj, coffee/tea, & cereal), room service w/a limited but reasonably priced menu (5-9PM), & dinner & cocktails w/a more expansive & expensive array of choices. The hotelâ€™s valet parking is $25 +14% tax/day, so we drove to the Lafayette BART station from Sacramento & left our car w/its long-term parking permit there, taking BART to the Civic Center station where we walked Â½ mile to the hotel. We had reserved a newly â€œrenovatedâ€� room trying for the newest bed they had. The renovated rooms all had flat screen TVs & I-pod docks, but otherwise the wood furniture was still chipped & scratched, wall paper stained & peeling in places, & the beds 7-10 years old. The front desk person let us try 3 rooms, but all had the same beds. We settled on a 2nd floor â€œrenovatedâ€� room. The rooms are all on one side of the narrow halls, looking out onto the building next door, the street, or the window of the room down the hall. There are 4 sizes of rooms each with a name. Ours was one size up from the smallest called an Orchestra room w/a separate small living area (9x12 feet) w/a firmly cushioned sofa, a table w/1 chair (upon request, a 2nd chair was delivered), a flat screen TV & simple DVD player on the wall, & a kitchenette w/a microwave, 3 cubic foot refrigerator, a sink, & a 2x3 foot counter, cabinets overhead containing tableware for 4 & dish cleaning supplies, & a coffee maker w/2 samples of caffeinated & decaf coffee. 2 narrow doors w/a light-weight cloth covering the glass separated the bedroom from the living area. The bedroom had a queen sized bed w/an old worn out spring mattress (we used the bedding to sleep on the living area floor), a luggage bench, recessed closet area w/flat screen TV & DVD machine, hanging area, shelves, & drawer space, 2 night stands, an I-pod dock, wall length mirror & 3 feet on either side of the bed. The bathroom had a stand-alone sink w/a narrow glass shelf above, which made using the sink difficult for washing the face, a hair dryer & night light, complimentary toiletries, towels for 2, shower/tub w/2 bars for aiding balance, & enough towel racks for all our towels, though the bath towel racks blocked access to the glass shelf. Our trip was good, with lots to see in the City, good weather, & delicious food. The hotel was a disappointment b/c of its dark hole like atmosphere & its incredibly worn out bed. We did write out a review to the hotel manager, who responded by email that they would fix the outlet, & the beds were due to be changed next year, but they might do the one room we stayed in earlier.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Alex V
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights during Thanksgiving week at this wonderful hotel. The entire staff was welcoming and very accomodating. The room was exceptionally clean, comfortable and met our every need. The front desk has fresh baked cookies daily at 3:00pm, chocolate on your night stand each night and a light continental breakfast every morning. The hotel is located in a very nice area of SF near the civic center within walking distance of many very nice restaurants. Across the street you can catch the SF hop on-hop off tour bus every 20 minutes. We will definately stay here each time we visit our family.....

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, efficient staff”
Reviews.Author: SeattleElaine
Reviews.Content: Stayed two days and could not have been more pleased with the room and the staff. Perfectly located. Will absolutely stay there again!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Birthday getaway”
Reviews.Author: Elan Lannie J
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Inn was wonderful, It is a unique setting. All of the staff was friendly and very helpful. And I would recommend the Inn at the Opera to anyone looking for a location other then the Wharf. I stayed at a hotel at the Wharf in April this year, they had less to offer then this quaint facility. I loved the ambiances.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: fistful_of_dollars
Reviews.Content: Got an amazing suite here for 99 dollars. Awesome room with living room.....kitchenette....dining table....comfy bed. Close to ballet and opera house and great restaurants. Bart isn't too far either...great breakfast. Would absolutely stay again..BTW avoid the standard rooms, I heard they are small as broom closets

Reviews.Title: “for all kinds of music lovers!”
Reviews.Author: Frank33630
Reviews.Content: At Civic Center in the middle of San Francisco--adjacent to Opera and Symphony halls, but, within walking distance of jazz at the Herbst, and free programs nearly daily at the S.F. Conservatory featuring students on their cutting edges of professional performance. Fantastic area for seniors with the availability of "Rush" tickets, (so reasonable) to great performances, and public transport within a block or two for a variety of museums, other musical venues, and good old sightseeing. We also walked over to "Glide Memorial Church" for an eye-opening Sunday morning experience. The Inn employees are very welcoming and the facilities immaculate. Building is not "glitzy" but is worth visiting. I am reminded of a dowager lady, now 50 years old, when visiting it.

Reviews.Title: “Euro Charm at Non-Euro Prices”
Reviews.Author: Mel H
Reviews.Content: My wife and I often stay at the Inn at the Opera because of its location to some of our favorite sites in San Francisco, and also because of the friendliness, helpfulness, and efficiency of the staff. The building is remodeled, wi-fi capable, and furnished throughout with flat screen televisions - yet overall you experience the more refined, small-touch feel of a bed-and-breakfast. The restaurant, Ovations, is elegantly furnished and the cuisine is diverse, appealing, and delicious - during performance seasons for the opera, symphony, and ballet Ovations is fully booked.

Reviews.Title: “Charming stay in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: mikeyb0in
Reviews.Content: This hotel is simple but elegant. It feels like from another time. The service was exceptionally good while we were here. The staff was very friendly, including the room cleaners. The complimentary breakfast was simple but nice; the dining room itself has a lot of class. Actually, this place *feels* like it should be next to the Opera House, so it's not just a clever name. One complaint was the mattress was a bit soft for my back, but maybe that's just me. Oh, and the room was very hot at night - but we were able to open the windows completely and get some fresh air. Bottom line, don't go here if you're looking for a typical newly done hotel with perfect modern amenities. This hotel is good for its vibe. It's elegant, but to the point of being pretentious, which is often the sort of vibe I get while in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “A quiet, comfortable little gem in San Francisco.”
Reviews.Author: toozigoot
Reviews.Content: The rooms are lovely, clean and the beds are comfy. Service is personal and attentive. The neighborhood has a good variety of small, delicious restaurants in walking distance. In fact you can walk easily to a number of bus or street car stops to get anywhere in the city. If you want a smaller hotel that caters to adults, you will love this place.

Reviews.Title: “Old World Charm”
Reviews.Author: USFmom14
Reviews.Content: This hotel reminds me of Europe. It's not big and glitzy. In fact you might look right past it if you were not looking for it specifically. But once you walk in you will be greeted my very helpful and welcoming staff. The restaurant and bar, where you will have breakfast in the morning, is very nice. Our room was very comfortable and clean and nicely decorated. The rooms and hall have a very old world feel to them. I really liked my stay and would definitely stay there again. Another plus was that the location was quiet compared to when I've stayed other times in San Francisco on Union Square.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: ViewsOfTheWorld
Reviews.Content: We were shopping around at the last minute for a hotel in San Fran; generally they looked over-priced and uninspiring. The Inn looked like the best for the price we wanted to pay, and it was. A nice old building right next to the Opera House and City Hall, with good transport links. The staff were really friendly and helpful and the continental breakfast was good. Room was clean and comfortable, and included a little kitchen area with fridge and microwave which was useful. Not the newest furniture or bathroom fittings, but everything worked and was clean. Would recommend, especially for the soothing classical music in the lift....

Reviews.Title: “Opera Lover's Dream”
Reviews.Author: Bayard W
Reviews.Content: This is an exquisite little gem of a hotel. I have been coming here for the last five years. It is the perfect hotel to stay at for the opera season in San Francisco. It is literally across the street from the War Memorial Opera House. Just walk out the front door and you are a short walk to your opera seats.The Continental Breakfast is casually elegant. I have tried all three types of rooms, and each one served its purpose beautifully. The staff has been consistently welcoming and helpful. My daughter and I look forward to our yearly visits.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: Angela S
Reviews.Content: Convenient place to stay in SF. Love this hotel. They always have a continental breakfast that is included with your stay. There is also a restauraunt and bar right in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: TomJJR
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. The staff treated us like we were special and were very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint and classy in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: aprilmike
Reviews.Content: The Inn at the Oprah is a wonderful place to stay. The rooms are clean and neat and all a person needs. The only detraction I have is the area where the the Inn is should be better advertised to the patrons so they know what is within walking distance. The service is 5 star and the restaurant is great. Give this hotel that is off the main path a chance and you will be pleasantly surprised.

Reviews.Title: “I really did leave my heart in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: Donna H
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful week in San Francisco and partly because of our stay at Inn at the Opera. It was charming and in a great location near city hall. We enjoyed walking in the immediate area enjoying a piece of San Francisco away from the busy Fisherman's Wharf area. We enjoyed having breakfast every morning at the hotel and although it was a cold breakfast, it was very good. The staff was very helpful and friendly, and the rooms spacious and clean. We enjoyed the fact that the Hop-on, Hop-off sight seeing bus stopped right outside the door of the hotel. A big plus. We will certainly stay here again and recommand it to our family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Decent stay away from the city”
Reviews.Author: kazfoodie
Reviews.Content: I had a decent stay here in July/August with my husband. We didn't realise the distance from the city although it's not that bad (just a short bus ride). If you're after a quiet stay away from busy Union Sq, then this is for you. Great thing about the location is that it's within walking distance to some cool and funky cafes and restaurants, as well as Alamo Square! We stayed at the Ballet room - the smallest one they have. Although it was tiny, it was clean. Hotel staff was friendly. Overall, it's an old, boutique hotel with a bit of charm. Ok if you're not after luxury, this is for you.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel near performing arts venues”
Reviews.Author: travelerformusic
Reviews.Content: Lovely boutique hotel with clean, well-appointed rooms, located near the city's performing arts venues. Friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Marklaw
Reviews.Content: I really really liked this hotel. Room was delightful - comfortable and clean. Got a very good night's sleep in the room. Could open the window and hear the Opera next door. Great location. Nice staff. Good breakfast. If you need to be in the Civic Center, this is a great place to stay. Not a chain, but a one-off that is stellar. You can stay at the St. Francis or the Hopkins but you won't get a better room or a nicer stay for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Our fave place to stay in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: Anita A
Reviews.Content: Inn at the Opera has become our favorite spot to stay while in San Francisco. Hayes St with its shopping and restaurants is just around the corner. Opera is across the street. Two blocks to city hall, where we buy our MUNI passes for bus and cable car. Employees at Inn at the Opera usually go the extra mile to help. They're very good about helping with bus routes. Their restaurant suggestions have most often been right on.

Reviews.Title: “Okay, but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: bestcatlady
Reviews.Content: We were told we had received "an upgrade" so I would hate to see the room we were originally assigned. There were two very small rooms and a bathroom, and the set-up was rather awkward. We received no housekeeping service until the fourth day we were there - we were in and out a alot so it wasn't a big deal, but it would have been nice to return to a cleaned up room. The continental breakfast was good - had great bagels and muffins.

Reviews.Title: “Complete rip off”
Reviews.Author: Aisontheroad
Reviews.Content: Was looking for a decent hotel uner $200, and went for this on the basis of the reviews. Room was tiny, even though I choose an 'up grade' as I was told at reception that the standard room was small. I could not get a cell phone reception in my room - although I normally get a signal when others can't, so had to make private calls in the lobby or on the street, and friends in SF could not reach me. The room was noisy - noise came from outside - garage next door, the corridor, and from other rooms, seemingly through every vent in the room. Location was desolate at night. Then I was charged $250 for the night. I checked out and got a room in the Four Seasons for the same price on a special deal. I would never go back and never recommend this place. The only reason I gave it poor not terrible was the staff were friendly - well most of them.

Reviews.Title: “Not Enough Room to Swing a Cat!”
Reviews.Author: NJ_ThursdaysChild
Reviews.Content: After a wonderful week in the sister property, Suites at Fisherman's Wharf, Hurricane Irene cancelled my return flight to NJ and the wonderful staff at SFW went out of their way to arrange a room at the Inn at the Opera at a discounted rate of $129 per night. I was clear that I was traveling with a friend, and we definitely needed two beds, or a bed with sleep sofa. Miguel, the manager at SFW, told me he'd spoken to the Inn management and they could provide a rollaway bed. I had been told we had a "Studio" room reserved, with mini-fridge,microwave, and coffeepot. So off we went, excited to be spending 2 days in a new part of town and in a property I'd not seen before. When we arrived, the staff at Inn at the Opera stored our bags until the room was ready. They told me they did not have an available room with a sleep sofa, or with 2 double beds, but did have rollaway beds, and once again, I stressed to them that we definitely needed 2 beds. My friend and I went off to find lunch and adventure, and came back shortly after three PM to check into our room. At the desk, I asked about the rollaway bed. The desk clerk told me that, sadly, they had given out the last one, but that the bed would be comfortable for both of us. When I asked why a rollaway wasn't held for us, as the reservation had been made on Thursday, 2 days before, he told us that no matter when it's reserved, it's on a first come, first served basis. After a hurried consultation at the desk, my friend and I went to look at the room, to see if we could survive the next 2 days comfortably. What a shock when we walked into the room. The bellman who brought our luggage up could barely get all 4 suitcases in the room. The overall room size, including the bathroom, narrow entrance hall, and "kitchenette"(a microwave and coffeeepot on a shelf over a mini-frig, no counter or work space), was barely 160 s.f. There was a full-size bed (measured it...certainly wasn't a queen) and one small 24" round table jammed into a corner with a big lamp sitting on it and a chair in front of it. Other than that and the bed, no place to sit, no room to swing a cat! And even a mid-afternoon on a sunny day, with all the lights on, the room was distressingly dark. Even if I were traveling alone, I would not have stayed in that room. While I've traveled throughout Europe and understand the concept (and size and scale)of a European style hotel, that room was just...sad. Twenty minutes later I had booted up my laptop, logged onto priceline, and found a four-star (The Omni Hotel, on California St in the Financial District) for $130 per night. I called downstairs for the bellman again, and when I checked out, I asked the front desk clerk where he was planning on putting the rollaway bed if one had been available, and he admitted that they knew there was no place in that room to put one. I think that was the most infuriating part of the whole situation for me. Not only had they misled and outright lied to me, but they also jeopardized the reputation of Miguel at SFW by allowing him to promise something they had never any intention of delivering. Away we went. Twenty minutes later we were ensconced in a very beautiful and spacious room at the Omni with two queen size beds, a large desk, a table and easy chair, and plenty of light. Heaven, while we waited out Irene.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good”
Reviews.Author: Lizc365
Reviews.Content: Lovely friendly staff - all extremely helpful. Well situated - right by City Hall so downtown is walkable but plenty of buses running regularly. Hotel was very clean, everthing there you would need, however the room was quite small, which is fine if your stay is a short one but would get a bit much if your stay was for a week or so. They do however have suites, so I would recommend that. Breakfast was good!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: redgr
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed the hotel very much. It is very convenient to all the major transportation routes. The breakfast is complimentary and good. Service is very friendly and accommodating. We would definitely come back to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Inn at the Opera-a great "upscale" SF option, but here are a few truths too”
Reviews.Author: gben88
Reviews.Content: I had to be in SF for business and for a conference near City Hall. I needed a hotel that met my company expense account requirements (not easy in San Francisco), especially during the weekend of the SF Marathon. When a Holiday Inn room in SF is priced at $279 a night, you know itâ€™s going to be a challenge to find anything decent, but by booking 6 weeks in advance I was able to secure a room at Inn at the Opera for $124 a night before tax, Ballet studio using my AAA membership rate. The Inn at the Opera Building is a narrow 7 story building right next to the San Francisco Ballet building on Franklin and Fulton streets. The hotel lobby is not big, but the hotel photos reflect it accurately. Continue walking straight past the front desk and you will see a small business center with computer and printer, and then the Ovation restaurant and bar in the back. This is where the continental breakfast was served each morning and it opens for dinner at night. I had read other Tripadvisor reviews that mentioned how small the Ballet studio could be and how some did not have a desk or sitting area. I called and then e-mailed about a week out to request a Ballet suite with a desk. Iâ€™m glad I did because while the room was smaller (about 200 sf) it did have everything I needed including a nice built in kitchenette with microwave, refrigerator, sink, dishes, wine glasses, flatware and cups as well as a coffeemaker. The room had a flat panel screen TV-it looked like it was about 27â€�, but adequate with a DVD player. There was also a nice sized armoire to hold hanging suits as well as 3 large drawers for clothing. The bed was very comfortable with very nice soft linens and pillows. The towels in the bathroom were also very plush. The Inn appears to have about 14 rooms per floor. It looks like the Ballet studio can vary from reasonable to one â€œHotwireâ€� level room tucked towards the back of the building. This must be the one others on this site have complained about as it looked tiny. I think my room; Room 26 was a medium sized ballet studio. The hotel website shows a ballet suite with a nice couch and bay windows-if this is so, I was not offered one of those. I have attached a floor plan to this review so that you can see how the floors actually layout. You will see the only 2 rooms on the whole floor are the same room represented as a â€œBallet Suiteâ€� on their website. The hotel was sold out that weekend, but service didnâ€™t seem to suffer at all. The staff are very nice and competent-Jesse at the Front desk deserves recognition for how helpful and polite he always was. His attitude is a great reflection on the Inn. This place is truly a small boutique style Inn. It is not a 4 or 5 star hotel. It is more of a 3- star place, as the furniture while nice is a little dated to the 80â€™s The elevator many complained about is indeed small-about the size of a coat closet, with a door you have to open manually so that you can get in the elevator cab. Some may find this charming, but itâ€™s more of an annoyance if you are trying to get your bags in while balancing the door. This hotel reminds me of an old Town or University club, with furnishings you might see in your grandmothers house-nicely cared for but a little worn. There were lots of Europeans there when I stayed there. They seemed to overtake the continental breakfast buffet so I would just take a plate up to my room each morning. The buffet has sliced melon, bagels, cream cheese, boiled eggs, cottage cheese and English muffins. It could use some cold cuts or cheeses. In summary, for the price it is a bargain but also bear in mind that you get what you pay for. The fact that it was close to the BART /Airport train, the Muni, and the other places I needed to go around City Hall made it very convenient. By the way, for many years I would rent a car in SF and pay the ridiculous parking charges. Once I got to know the BART and Muni routes there was no reason to have a car-the public transport options in San Francisco are just fantastic. I bought a 7 day â€œPassportâ€� pass that is good on the Muni, Cable Cars, etc. It will get you anywhere you need to go, and you can buy them at City Hall on the first floor, or at the Powell/Market Muni station. Their website is www.SFMuni.com if you want to check it out. Here are my likes and dislikes of Inn at the Opera: â€œLikesâ€� Coffee and Wet Bar in Room Good towels Continental Breakfast Free newspapers (except Sunday) Hotel staff Location-great SF neighborhood Relative ease getting from SFO airport via BART Housekeeping is excellent Pretty fast taxi service-via front desk phone call â€œDislikesâ€� Circa 1996 Third world country Internet speeds if it connects at all Hotel not entirely forthcoming about what â€œBalletâ€� suites really are Check-out time of 11:00 am Alley or no view from a majority of the rooms Extremely narrow and dark hallways and ancient elevator Disappearing doorman/valet (rarely saw them) Poor television reception TV remotes didnâ€™t work Very poor air ventilation/circulation in the hotel No pool or fitness area or alternatives in the neighborhood Having stayed primarily at 4 or 5 star hotels on Nob Hill, Union Square or the Financial District during past stays in SF, I would say this was a decent alternative, because the location was convenient to where I needed to be. But I would not consider it a 4 star hotel. The facility is 3 stars and the staff makes it 3-1/2, in my opinion. Just be sure to call them to know exactly what you are booking or you may be very disappointed. They should really do a better job of posting pictures of all possible Ballet studio options, rather than that of the bay windowed one with the couch. Reminds me a bit of â€œputting lipstick on a Pigâ€�.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely...”
Reviews.Author: AriannaSunshine
Reviews.Content: Inn at the Opera and Hayes Valley were a highlight of our trip to San Francisco. The accommodations were comfortable, the staff was friendly and helpful and the location was excellent. We had one glitch in that the lock on our door malfunctioned. The situation was handled as well as could be and we were generously compensated for the inconvenience. Thank you for an excellent experience. We will happily return!!! :)

Reviews.Title: “Great value in a great SF neighbourhood.”
Reviews.Author: naturodoc
Reviews.Content: I just spent a really enjoyable weeklong stay at Inn at the Opera. The staff were all exceptionally friendly and helpful. I stayed in a Ballet suite and found it to be spacious enough for my needs. Very clean and quiet. The hotel is also conveniently located to public transit and the trendy Hayes Valley neighbourhood. I have made many trips to SF and this has been my most enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, small rooms”
Reviews.Author: liska73
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel which has its share of good and bad things. The reception and staff are very friendly and helpful- beyond any expectations. This is the strongest point about this hotel - people who run it. The weakest link are rooms. The rooms are dismally small ( i was given one the size of a closet and then changed to a slightly bigger one with more noise )and everything on a street side is rattled by garbage collectors in the morning wee hours. Breakfast is nothing to write about : bad coffee, some pastries , basic cereal , boiled eggs. The location is OK , on of a safer areas . Homeless are fewer than average and not terribly aggressive . Union Plaza is 10 dollars taxi ride. Taxis are impossible to catch over the weekend and in the evening. Get yours by calling and prepare to wait.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location- Historic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ontheroadagain800
Reviews.Content: This is an interesting little place located right near the Opera House, Symphony Hall etc. It is walking distance to great little shops and places to eat in the Hayes area. BART (Civic Center) is about 4 blocks away. At night the walk from BART can be a little iffy as there are so many people camped out in the park and in doorways. If you are alone it can be a little disconcerting. As for the hotel- I stayed in the ballet type room which is a studio unit. There is a very small fridge and microwave with plates, silverware and dishes which is nice. Its an older property so the rooms are small but have a lot of character. Shower is great with plenty of water pressure and hot water. The beds are very comfy and the towels are big and fluffy. The complimentary continental breakfast is really only so-so. If I was only here a few days it probably would have been great but after a few weeks I was willing to pay for other options just for variety. Juice, coffee/tea, english muffins, bagels, melon, hard-boiled eggs and cold cereal pretty much sum it up. They put signs up saying to limit your breakfast to 30mins when the property is busy?? That did not feel friendly but it does get crowded on weekends. I did not eat dinner in the restaurant but the room service menu was reasonably priced and the onion soup is excellent!! I liked the rooms facing the front of the hotel- great views and much quieter than the ones on the corner- not sure why but the street noise is louder on the corners. There is no air conditioning and some rooms have ceiling fans and some don't. In July its actually quite cool (60s- low 70s) so I was not needing it at all. The staff is not what I would call overly friendly but they are helpful if you make requests. I don't have a car here but if you do- parking is pricey but hey---its San Francisco. There is free parking on the street but watch for the street cleaning rules/days and don't leave anything of value to tempt people. All in all a good hotel for getting to anywhere in the SF Bay area and beyond.

Reviews.Title: “Our choice in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: ckori
Reviews.Content: Conveniently located in the up and coming Hayes Valley area, this hotel and staff is excellent. The suite rooms are large and comfortable, free wifi, great continental breakfast, and the staff is so friendly and helpful. They will book tours, arrange transportation and give restaurant recommendations - as they eat at these place themselves!

Reviews.Title: “We would stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: Taraesther
Reviews.Content: This is located in a nice area called Hayes Valley-cute shops and good restaurants. Centrally located for walking to most "tourist"destinations and easy access to public transportation. Valet parking seems pricey but the best alternative to street or public lots. Had a problem getting my sunroof to close but valet was able to help and he fixed it. We had a great stay and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff, Great Location, Comfortable Room”
Reviews.Author: JandJ67
Reviews.Content: We stayed here a week in June to be near the opera, and the hotel is about 100 yards from an entrance to the opera house. (See a bit of the opera house in the third photo. It is the large building below and beyond the flags.) The Inn is also very close to orchestra hall, Herbst theater, the beautiful city hall, major bus lines, and BART. There are several excellent cafes and restaurants nearby. Our room faced the very quiet street, and to our surprise we had a mini-fridge and microwave. (There is a small shop nearby for sandwiches and beverages, including wine and liquor.) The bed was comfortable and the bathroom had a nice bathtub. The decor of the lobby, hallways, and dining room is refined. Staff were very friendly and the breakfast, while not lavish, was adequate. Many of the other guests were from foreign countries, and the whole atmosphere was pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms. Good location”
Reviews.Author: Citygir
Reviews.Content: I was given the smallest room in thd hotel on the first night (1 foot of walking space between the wall and the bed). The next night I was given a much larger room when I told then I was going to change hotel. The night clerk refused to change my room the first night. Good location for the bart and Civic Center. Not a bad hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Always a pleasure”
Reviews.Author: JPIUS93728
Reviews.Content: Every time we go San Francisco we make it a point of staying at The Inn at the Opera. While it is am older hotel the rooms are still well appointed and comfortable. The location is excellent in the Hayes Valley District of San Francisco right behind the Opera House. There are many fine restuarants in a three block walking radius. Over all the service at the hotel has been excellent and the staff very easy to deal with.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for the opera”
Reviews.Author: ACG26
Reviews.Content: We stayed here while attending the Ring Cycle at the San Francisco Opera. The location is perfect, especially for an opera that ends late at night; you simply cross the street and you're there. The staff were very friendly and efficient, the room was quite large for the city, and the buffet breakfast was quite good. There are also quite a few good restaurants in the neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: davidhchess
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Inn at the Opera as part of a holiday (but needing to work while there) in San Francisco, primarily to visit the opera so location was an important factor in our choice and, on reflection, is the hotelâ€™s main asset. As other reviewers have stated, staff were friendly and helpful. We had a ballet room and, like others, found the furniture and layout unsuitable for business use. However, we were moved the following day to another ballet room with a desk and a chair so, if you need these items it would be worth saying so when booking. There is some traffic and other guest noise but we did not find it unacceptable. Our room was on the seventh floor so lift access was necessary. The lift is small, only accepting four guests at a time, and the wait for it, though never unacceptably long, could be tiresome at times. The room we stayed in was a little on the small and dark side but did have the benefit of a fridge, micro wave, coffee maker and sink. Wardrobe facilities (I was told that this is closet in American!) were entirely inadequate for any but a weekend stay. As we were staying for nine days this was an important matter. There is no air conditioning. There was a large flat screen TV with sufficient channels to maintain our interest and an iPod dock and DVD player. WiFi access is free and the speed, though not lightening, is acceptable for business use, however, network contact failed on a regular basis. Fixing this was simple enough, just a matter of logging on again, but it was irritating as were the odd connection delays. There were sufficient points to allow us charge our phones, iPad, Kindle etc. An ironing board and iron are provided. Everything was clean and well serviced, with the odd, minor occasional omission. The small bathroom was functional enough. The shower was adequate but, I suspect, not entirely working to specification and I would have thought that renovation will soon be needed. The sink was very slightly chipped. The breakfast buffet was acceptable. However, in our nine day stay, the lack of variety became a little boring. Service was reasonable enough though it seemed that staffing levels were not sufficient to cope easily with a full room. Restaurant and bar hours (5 p.m. â€“ 9 p.m.) seemed rather restrictive. As an Englishman, I may not understand the American way of tipping, but I felt that the pad left on every table at breakfast for guests to add a tip on a daily basis was, well, unsubtle! We ate once in the Ovation restaurant. Prices were high for the location, about $130 â€“ 150 for two people taking two courses with a glass of wine each including tax and 15% tip. European visitors would need to brace themselves for the shock of the cost of $10 for an admittedly generous glass of house red. Food quality was about acceptable at the price but portions were small by American standards. At the room rate we paid, and as Opera goers we were supposedly receiving a discount, I would have said that the hotel was a little on the expensive side for what we received but I have no knowledge of San Francisco rates generally. I would have said 3.5 stars but Tripadvisor don't provide the option!

Reviews.Title: “"Thanks, but no thanks"”
Reviews.Author: larsykate
Reviews.Content: After planning a special weekend for our fourtieth anniversary, we were sadly disappointed that our confirmed reservations were not entered at the reception desk! They asked that we give them some time to check further, so we walked to have a light dinner. When we returned, the clerk apologized, saying that they simply had no room for us. To make it up to us, they obtained a room at the Hotel Majestic, several blocks away, and offered to "comp" the room and parking for one night. We managed to get to the Hotel Majestic and be shown to our room just in time to change from our travelling clothes to make the concert at Symphony Hall! The Majestic was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy, quiet hotel and we will be back.”
Reviews.Author: rysgma
Reviews.Content: The Inn at the Opera is conveniently located in the Hayes district of San Francisco,near the Civic Center, Opera House and public transportation. This small hotel is cozy with a friendly, helpful staff that could answer questions about local restaurants and how to's for getting to sites. There were a number of restaurants within 2-3 blocks with a variety of cuisine choices and price points. We had a ballet room which was small, but well appointed and was a good value for the price. The hotel was quiet and the staff eager to please. The continental breakfast was what you would expect with muffins, English muffins and bagels; hard-boiled eggs, fresh fruit, cottage cheese and sliced tomatoes. Nothing extraordinary, but enough to eat. Both the bus, Muni and Bart stops and stations were withing 2 blocks of the hotel which was a plus in the San Francisco area. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, comfortable and in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Katiefgreen
Reviews.Content: We would recommend this hotel if you prefer something a bit smaller and cosier than the big chains. Elegant, stylish, comfortable with a great breakfast buffet. The room was on the small size, but fine for a few nights. We found the staff very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: yingpo
Reviews.Content: The staff was great; the small rooms were cozy and the suite was nice. The beds are great, the cookies, great, too. Pretty restaurant and the "continental breakfast" was very good. Perfect location for Davies Symphony Hall activities and near the very good Hayes St. restaurant. We were very pleased with everything and could walk to all the places we wanted to go.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Stay at the Inn at the Opera.”
Reviews.Author: TheBrowns07
Reviews.Content: The staff was friendly and helpful. It was 3pm when we arrived, and we wanted to relax with a glass of wine before our dinner reservation at the hotel's restaurant Ovations. The front desk staff provided us with a full page list of other restaurants that were rated by price that we could go to within the area for drinks and food. We went at the Blue Muse which was only a couple of blocks away from the hotel for a glass of wine. The bartenders and the locals at Blue Muse were great. We had another glass of wine at the bar at Ovations when they opened at 5pm, and our dinner was amazing. Our room was quaint, and comfortable. The staff gave us a map to find our way around the city, and the access to public transportation was easy to get to from the hotel. We had a great trip.

Reviews.Title: “an elegant, friendly and comfortable hotel esconced on a quiet street in the civic center opposite the magnificent oper”
Reviews.Author: carole843
Reviews.Content: Upon entering the hotel one could imagine it being the setting for a novel or film and the decor artwork and other miscellaneous objects such as a magnificent guitar seem to suggest a long history of being near the cultural center and having some notables from the opera and art world. The beautifully restored elevator adds to its historical setting. The service was impeccable and they really went out of their way to make you feel comfortable and it was evident that they wanted to please. Although the hotel does not have a pool and the rooms are smaller than some of the larger hotels, the fact that this hotel is on a relatively quite street with a beautiful view of City Hall and the Ballet, other factors make up for everything else in my opinion. this hotel could easily be the subject for a novel or a film as its decor, artwork and other elegantly placed objects exude an elegant effect and one feels that music and art history have been a part of this hotel for a very long time.This hotel opened in 1927 and was originally an apartment building, They retained the historical elements such as the elevator and beautifully mahogany dining room which serves a lovely free, cold complimentary breakfast every morning of your stay. The service is impeccable and they take the time to make sure that your stay is enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy room, focus on service”
Reviews.Author: Beth_sage
Reviews.Content: Selected a smaller hotel rather than my travel site's picks. The room was comfy although the wardrobe space was a bit odd. Restaurant had a private party the night I arrived but the front desk clerk made sure I received super room service. Amenities fit all my needs , including a robe - and Ioved the character of the room. The staff were all very attentive, and all my needs were met promptly.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located with excellent service and food”
Reviews.Author: sea_gayle
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Inn at the Opera with my adult daughter for three nights. The staff at the front desk quickly ordered cabs, gave accurate directions to attractions and restaurants and called us by name on the second day. The hotel is located steps from the San Francisco Opera, has its own excellent restaurant for dinner and room service and is just a block and a half from public transportation to the Wharf or Union Square. There are many specialized restaurants within three blocks of fairly level walking. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, European style accomodations”
Reviews.Author: billvfitz
Reviews.Content: I searched for a hotel close to Davies Symphony Hall and found this gem. There are a lot of reviews for Inn at the Opera and they were mostly positive, so I booked one of the small "Ballet" rooms. I was a little concerned when I realized that this hotel was part of the dreaded "time-share" system, but there was absolutely no sign of it when we checked in and not a hint of anything in the way of a sales pitch. The accomodations were modest, but well-maintained and spotlessly clean. The room of course was very small, but we did not plan to spend much time in the room since we were sightseeing. The hotel has an old-world charm about it and it felt very comfortable. Every staff member that we had contact with was pleasant and helpful. The breakfast that came with the room was good, but basic - coffee, juice, muffins, some fresh fruit, and cottage cheese and a few other things. The location is great - very close to the Civic Center with all its attractions. Davies symphony Hall is literally right around the corner. We needed to open the windows to get the room to a comfortable temperature and became aware of quite a bit of noise from outside, but no more than could be expected at the center of the city, and it quieted down a lot fairly early in the evening. We did a lot of walking around and never felt any sense of uneasiness. There was a lot of pedestrian traffic and many restaurants close by (we enjoyed the Hayes Street Grill). All in all, this was a great place to stay and we enjoyed our time in San Francisco very much.

Reviews.Title: “An older and dated hotel â€“ I wish I had paid more for better”
Reviews.Author: Joe_33
Reviews.Content: What I Liked â€¢ Relatively affordable â€“ I paid $160 per night. I wish I had paid $50 more per night for a better hotel (although all my years of staying in San Francisco I have struggled to find anywhere decent to stay that is affordable â€“ I donâ€™t know what it is about San Francisco and New York that means the hotels are either poor or very expensive). â€¢ Not that far from anywhere (but not close to anywhere either). â€¢ Couch in room. â€¢ Most of the staff friendly / helpful (with one exception â€“ why did I get her to check me in?). A couple of them really helpful with storing my bags. â€¢ Not much street noise for central San Francisco. Less Good â€¢ Very few facilities nearby (restaurants, cafes) â€¢ Internet very slow and typically dropped a couple of times per hour (gets very frustrating!) â€¢ No desk or chair in the room â€“ difficult to do much work. After 4 days my back is suffering from typing on the couch. â€¢ A limited number of TV channels and about half of them with no reception. Watching TV not much of an option. â€¢ Small bathroom and especially small shower. â€¢ 5 block walk to Market Street and then need to use public transport to get anywhere. â€¢ Kept waiting 50 minutes for check-in and given â€œexcusesâ€� (some of the reasons given were clearly lies designed to pacify me â€“ of course they did the opposite) for why room not ready. This was my first encounter with the hotel and set the tone for my stay. â€¢ Breakfast basic â€“ unripe melon and the rest basic motel standard. After 2 days I started to take breakfast out and that felt a lot better. The hotel dining room is dark with no natural light. â€¢ Banging from the room above me as they walk around (sounds like wooden floors) and I can clearly hear them take a shower. â€¢ Room stuffy with old / dated hotel smell (not unbearable, but not a smell I would chose). Conclusion This hotel felt like the least that could be provided for the most money. Dated without delivering quality it tries to suggest. Bed just about acceptable to me. I wouldnâ€™t stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “All the comforts of an upscale vacation.”
Reviews.Author: pmbleam
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed at The Inn at the Opera for 1 wk. & we're treated like royality. The service couldn't have been better. The rooms were well maintained, very clean & very comfy. We slept like babies & felt very spoiled. The best part - - - it was Quiet. Never heard a sound from other rooms or even outside at night!!! Thank you Inn at the Opera - - - -we'll be back!!!!

Reviews.Title: “we thoroughly enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: jatdmd
Reviews.Content: The location and service were great. We highly recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Location, comfort and price -- The Inn at the Opera has it all!”
Reviews.Author: keithprice1
Reviews.Content: Located just a 3 minute walk from the Opera House, which also stages San Francisco Ballet productions, the Inn is an old-fashioned but comfortable hotel at very reasonable prices. The tourist bus stops right across the street for those who want an overview of what the city has to offer and there are a myriad of boutiques and small ethnic eateries in the vicinity. We will definitely stay at the Inn on our next trip to SF. KP and AH, Toronto, Canada

Reviews.Title: “Will go back to this hotel, excellent service, location and staff.”
Reviews.Author: carol1farr
Reviews.Content: Quaint hotel, with an old fashion elegance. Close to Civic Centre, Museums, Opera, Ballet, but within in walking distance to "The Warf, Pier 39" (35 min walk). Great restaurants around the area. We booked the City Sightseeing Tour which had a stop 1 block away from the hotel - very convenient for us. Don't need a car in San Francisco, expensive to park. Hotel offers valet service and will park your car in a garage a few blocks away - cost is 28,00/night - we just left ours in the valet parking for the week. Walking was a great way to see all the different communities in SF and to walk off some of the great food we ate.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from Home”
Reviews.Author: muchachona
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at Inn at the Opera during our trip to San Francisco. We had reserved two rooms: a ballet for my father in-law and his wife, and an opera for us, family of 4 with teenagers. I called the hotel previously and to let them know we would be arriving late, and Javier was most kind. Upon entering, the hotel seems very small from the outside, but as soon as you enter you get this European feel of a turn of the century mansion. It is beautifuly decorated and also has a restaurant, but did not use it. Our room was great! We had a master bedroom with ensuite bathroom, a small dining table with 3 chairs, a kitchenette (microwave, fridge, coffe maker w/coffe, sink) and plenty of tableware for the whole family. It also had a sitting area with a sofa sleeper where my teenage daughters slept and another HUGE bathroom, which was very nice to have, so that we could all get ready in the morning faster. The hotel staff is extremely friendly and really get out of their way to make you feel welcome. They offered us fresh warm cookies and fresh apples whenever we wanted them. When we checked in, I requested extra towels, pillows, a fan and ice, and they were delivered in less than 10 minutes, and it was midnight! Great service. My in-laws were given a room a little small for their comfort, and next morning when we talked to Javier at the front desk, we were told they would change them to a larger one, and not to worry about the luggage (many!), that they would move it while we went on a tour all day long. They indeed did so and moved all my in-laws luggage to the new larger room and when we arrived that night, they were given new keys and everything was taken care of and they went straight to their new room and found all their belongings in order. My in-laws were very happy with the change. It was done in a smooth way and Javier always made us feel welcome and went out if his way to please our needs. Again, excelent service! Included in the rate was a continental breakfast, which is served in the restaurant area and it includes juices, milk, cereals, pastries, hard boiled eggs, yogurt and fresh fruit. Some people complain the hotel is not in the middle of the city, but it is just one block from the beautiful City Hall, and the the hop-on hop-off tour bus has a stop right in front of the hotel, which saved us a ton of money on cabs since these buses run every 20 minutes sharp and go all around the city center. Overall, we loved this hotel and would stay there again whenever we go back to San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Small, small, small”
Reviews.Author: Mplegere
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Ballet room....small, small, small. There was no room for our luggage. The walls were thin and the window might as well have been open for the amount of noise it stopped. The room was clean and the staff friendly and helpful. I would recommend this hotel but not this room.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay through RCI”
Reviews.Author: SCVoyageur
Reviews.Content: We booked a week at IATO through RCI for our annual stay in San Fran. This is our first time at IATO & we have no complaints. The Inn at the Opera has a distinctively European feel to it which we very much enjoy. We are in a suite on the 7th floor in a queen bedroom with a large plasma TV & full private white tile bathroom. There is a sitting room with French doors, a sofa bed & small plasma TV & a second private bathroom off the sitting room. The foyer doubles as a kitchenette with bar sink, very small micro., bar frig, plates, cups, glasses, cutlery for 4, wine, bottle/can openers, large knife, dish clothes and liquid & a coffee maker. Coffee packets are supplied each day as is maid service. There are 2 built-in closets, one in the bedroom, the other in the sitting room. The suite is set up to accommodate 4. It is spacious for 2. We are in an end unit which is very quiet except for the occassional siren. The Continental breakfast is the same each day with the only variation in the flavor of the large muffins. There are 2 cereals - Cheerios and corn flakes - hard cooked eggs in their shells & not rubbery, sliced melons & bananas, cottage & cream cheeses, bagels, tomatoes, yogurt, coffee & o.j. Mid-afternoon there are warm cookies; and apples are always available. We had Valentine's Day dinner in the hotel's French restaurant Ovations where breakfast is served. Dinner was excellent! We had duck breast and duck leg confit which was delicious and authentically prepared. A real surprise. The house Pinot was also very good. As written by others, the IATO is in the heart of the performing arts venues. Our room overlooks the SF Ballet. The IATO is also convenient to public transport. We left our rental car at SFO, caught the AirTrain to SFO BART to the Civic Center, exit the BART on 8th St. It takes half an hour on the BART from SFO & costs $8.10 p.p. We will return to SFO the same way. The Civic Center BART is a few blocks from IATO. Care should be taken after dark around the Civic Center.
