There are many reasonable restaurants near the IATO, as well as Absynthe, a French restaurant. As walkers, the location is not as convenient to tourist venues as other hotels but is quieter. Taking the Muni to Bernal Heights took half an hour but walking back only took 45 min. plus a stop for Turkish coffee at Philz; so for walkers, the location is fine. The staff is very friendly and helpful, whether the desk staff or the cleaning personnel. The desk staff has a list of restaurants that will deliver to your room, although Ovations provides room service. Our room was refreshed daily with mid-week sheet change. If there is anything negative, it might be the cost of parking at $25 a day & no on-site exercise facility. That said, we would highly recommend a stay at the IOTO for a night or a week & would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “I will stay here again, very comfortable beds!”
Reviews.Author: smusbach
Reviews.Content: My daughter was married at City Hall and this was the hotel she recommended as the best for what we needed. We had an 90 year old, an 86 year old, a couple in their 30's with a 10 month old, plus various other guests. It worked perfectly for all of us. Valet parking, walk to City Hall, Amazing helpful staff who was never too busy to leave a message or give a member of our party a heads up. We had basic rooms and one junior suite to hang out in and it was perfect. Breakfast was perfect to send us on our way for the day. I will recommend this to anyone who wants to stay in the city.

Reviews.Title: “best kept secret that is getting out”
Reviews.Author: traveltoutesuite
Reviews.Content: i have been staying at inn at the opera for 5 years. i fly up for the ballet. it could not be more ideally located. the staff at the Inn is extraordinary. yes, i said extraordinary. Jin (Jennifer) Rowena, Javier in the front end are more than exceptional. they greet you like family and do everything possible to make your stay memorable. the breakfast is more than ample. and the presentation is lovely. when recommendations are suggested, Sean, the GM acts on them. this is one of the most delightful boutique hotels i have visited. it is also a time share but hopefully they will continue to save rooms for non time share folk.

Reviews.Title: “looks cute but it sux”
Reviews.Author: rachelpoppe
Reviews.Content: it was soooo loud, i could here everything. The walls are paper thin! I couldnt believe it. There was a half eatin apple in our trash, the room was tiiiiiny, old little tvs, no room service or ice machine, the restaurant was closed at like 7pm every nigh becuase it wasnt "very busy". so for the price i think its terrible. Might as well stay at a bloody hostel. sorry guys

Reviews.Title: “2nd visit as wonderful as the first”
Reviews.Author: TAtripper
Reviews.Content: No complaints about this lovely property. There have been some reviews mentioning the dicey location, but even for the first time visitor there are ways around this. My husband and I are avid walkers (esp. when staying in SF) so we simply walk up Van Ness until we hit a street that bypasses the "dicey" area. If you aren't big on walking, grab a bus or walk the 4 blocks to Bart and you can take it. I will say ditto to the wonderful, friendly staff and excellent continental breakfast. I don't think there is a better value hotel in the city. If the reviews of room size frighten you then spring a little more for a bigger one - still a great value. Room size not much of an issue with us since we're there to see things - the room is for sleeping so if that's all you need the hotel for, you'll be fine. They are also immaculate and fairly quiet - easily worth double what we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect, almost: a few notes”
Reviews.Author: jeppa3579
Reviews.Content: It is difficult to draw negative comments about this hotel and I do not want to repeat the same applause about this hotel. So, I just make a few notes that may be helpful. 1. I stayed at the Inn for a conference at Moscone Center. I found the commute to and from the conference site somewhat dangerous, especially after sunset, with so many zombie-ish people at every corner, sometimes at every door on the streets. In fact, it was a bit of post-apocalyptic experience. I saw two arrests for the five days I had to commute. If I were there for opera, symphony, or ballet, the location couldn't have been better. 2. The room is small. If I had a child, it would have certainly been difficult to stay in. Also, there was no desk, so working in the room was almost out of the question.

Reviews.Title: “Great find - boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Anabelle44
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this hotel, if you are looking for something a little different. Rooms, while on the small side, are beautifully furnished and spotless. Staff are friendly. Continental breakfast is quite good and served in a lovely dining room.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel made our trip!”
Reviews.Author: canyon48
Reviews.Content: Inn at the Opera was a very pleasant surprise: a slice of old San Francisco lodgings with completely modern amenities. Their personnel were attentive and accomadating, their restaurant superb, and their lodgings absolutely wonderful. Located a block from city hall, the hotel allows you to access any part of old San Francisco with a $10 cab ride. Absolutely the best!

Reviews.Title: “My husband and I loved staying at Inn at the Opera in San Francisco, CA.”
Reviews.Author: DaemeinAnna
Reviews.Content: My husband and I would totally recommend this hotel to anyone wanting some time by themselves. It is quaint, romantic and above all the staff are so hospitable. We were celebrating our 9th anniversary and the hotel gave us a room with a wonderful view and a complimentary bottle of wine. The little "touches" meant so much to my husband and myself. We definitely plan on going again next year. From a very happily married couple from El Cajon, California

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Find!”
Reviews.Author: GinnyAlamo
Reviews.Content: We loved Inn at the Opera! We were here for a week through an RCI timeshare exchange. We had a studio suite which was really just a tiny hotel room. However, it appeared to be recently updated, was very clean and as an added surprise, we were entitled to the free high-end continental breakfast daily. The service we received was superior! The staff cannot do enough for you and are always pleasant. We were identified by our names throughout our entire stay. The location is just perfect. It's directly next door to the ballet but also convenient to all public transportation. If you need a taxi, the front desk is more than willing to call one for you. By the end of our week, we felt like locals! What a pleasant place to stay. We're looking forward to returning!

Reviews.Title: “Inn at the Opera has one of the friendliest staffs of any hotel I have stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: Lizzieshg
Reviews.Content: I stay at this hotel several times a year. It is very charming, clean and quiet. The staff is the friendliest and most helpful of any hotel I have stayed in anywhere in the world. Each guest is greeted cheerfully, your bags are out of your car before you even get out of the car many times, your car is parked carefully and you have 24 hour valet service. The front desk staff always has a smile and cheerful greeting during my stay. The rooms are not large but they are very well organized to make the best use of the space. Wifi is very easy to access in all parts of the hotel. They are clean and nicely furnished and the housekeeping staff is very accommodating and friendly. Breakfast in the morning is simple but plenty for me and it is served in their lovely dining room. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoy San Francisco as it was meant to be”
Reviews.Author: JPatric818
Reviews.Content: This was our first time staying at the Inn at the Opera. Over the years we have stayed in other boutique hotels in the area. The Inn at the Opera is, by far, our favorite. There is an feeling of luxury and class. The public areas are appointed nicely, and the restaurant is cozy and warm. Our room was perfect for our needs, and having free Internet a perk every hotel should provide. The staff was courteous and very helpful. Plus, the location is perfect for making use of the various forms for public transportation or traveling outside the city.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional service”
Reviews.Author: rsbigroup
Reviews.Content: Like aways...greated by a warm welcome...warm cookies are an added treat at check in. We have been owners for 11 years...Ricardo our waiter at breakfast has always given us exceptional service...

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location!...great first stay in SF!”
Reviews.Author: LanderSings
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to San Fran and I am so very glad that I choose Inn at the Opera. I had an interview in the area and attended SF Opera...it was perfect for everything that I needed it to be. Walking distance to the opera, shops, restaurants, etc...location was perfect for me. The hotel was very nice, my room was clean, cozy and comfortable, and the continental breakfast was great too. I don't have a gripe only this...be aware that there is only one elevator in the hotel and it does not run fast, but it's charming...so just something to be aware of. Otherwise, great stay and highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, but ultimately disappointing”
Reviews.Author: rschultz
Reviews.Content: The rooms were well appointed but extremely small. Only could fit a queen sized bed in the room with limited manuevering space. Room had no HVAC, only a radiator for heat. Being required to pay for Valet Parking is a sore spot for me, because I only called for the car once a day during our 3 day stay. That being said, I paid nearly $100 for 3 days of valet parking with 3 retrievals. A little excessive, i think. The restaurant was ok with excellent service and good quality food. Pricy, but well prepared and enjoyable. We had a noise problem every night of our stay and I finally had to call the desk to complain about someone rummaging through the dumpster on the street and tossing bottles into a shopping cart. The noisy activity woke us up and looking out the window at the fellow below reveailed that he had little concern for being very noisy with his activity. Tossing bottles into a shopping cart at 2 am in the morning. I took the front desk 15-20 minutes to go outside and ask the dumpster guy to keep the noise down. It didn't work as he made more noise than before. I wouldn't stay there again, opting for a more spacious, quiet, and parking friendly hotel instead. ..

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: Mahler10
Reviews.Content: My experience was so bad I nearly moved. The promised free Internet access didn't work, which was a disaster for me. Fortunately the nearby Arlequin Cafe is wonderful, has free Internet, and is around the corner. I practically moved in there. To be fair, the hotel had the Internet repaired by the time I left. My room was tiny, with no desk, one hard chair, and a miniscule closet, if you can call it that. The walls were paper thin and I heard everything my neighbors said. They started talking at 6 a.m. The free coffee was bad, and I took breakfast each day at the aforementioned Arlequin Cafe, passing up the free option at the Inn. The restaurant, Ovation, is also to be avoided. Fortunately there are excellent options on nearby Hayes St. As for location, cabs are nowhere to be found and it's a long walk to the nearest muni station. And while walking anywhere, be prepared for the homeless camped in every doorway. The staff was nice, but obfuscated whenever I complained, such as their claim that the Internet service was "slow" at certain hours because so many people were tapping into it from outside the hotel. My bed was never made during the day and "turn down" service also failed my last evening. There are far better options in San Francisco, even if you're going to the opera.

Reviews.Title: “Like home only better”
Reviews.Author: anacaro15
Reviews.Content: Inn at the Opera is a small boutique hotel with a friendly staff and great service. It is clean, affordable, and situated next to the Opera House and Symphony Hall. Public transportation makes it very easy to be in the best parts of the city within minutes. Walking in the vicinity is both safe and enjoyable. As a single woman I feel very comfortable walking home from the symphony, opera, or ballet at night and eating dinner in the restaurants close by. There is also an excellent movie theater two blocks away. Inn at the Opera's location makes it easy to get to from Caltrain and BART that comes from the SF airport. There is a fabulous buffet breakfast that is included, served in the exclusive restaurant on the premises.

Reviews.Title: “Forget the Opera, this is a great hotel for a City Break”
Reviews.Author: willoDorset
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 4 nights at the back end of a six week RTW and had no intention of going to the Opera! Based upon prior reviews we thought it represented good VFM and it did. Although not in Union Square or Fishermans Wharf the location is fine for a base to explore all that SF has to offer being no more than 5 minutes walk from bus or streetcar stops (or BART City Hall if arriving from airport as we did) so dont be put off if you are not an Opera fan! We had a very comfortable concerto room on the 6th floor and it was very quiet. Breakfast is nothing special but does the job and it is free! Can't find fault anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and staff”
Reviews.Author: Frank33630
Reviews.Content: The name suggests that the Inn is only for serious music lovers. It is--but also much more. Its central location makes a car unnecessary because of public transportation and the entire staff stands ready to assist with answers to any questions and willingness to assist. We saw several musical events "for free" and low-cost tickets for other events need to be purchased the same day as the event. The location of the Inn makes that a simple walk of a block of two. The building is very clean and well-maintained although all rooms are quite compact.

Reviews.Title: “Cute, good price”
Reviews.Author: Boodleheimer
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Inn at the Opera because of reviews posted here and proximity to the Inner Sunset, which doesn't have many lodging choices. The Inn's staff was great. The room was small, but there were only two of us and we didn't spend much more than sleeping time there. The continental breakfast was fresh, with good variety -- bagels, yogurt, cereal, fresh fruit, juices.

Reviews.Title: “delightful experience!”
Reviews.Author: papaell
Reviews.Content: charming albeit tiny room; clean, well appointed and comfortable. friendly, knowledgeable, helpful stall pleasant continental breakfast in the elegant restaurant easy valet parking wonderful location, steps from the SF opera

Reviews.Title: “Excellent customer service”
Reviews.Author: gerberadaisylucy2296
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Inn at the Opera twice and both times have been very enjoyable. The customer service is excellent, the rooms are small but very comfortable, and it definitely has the old world charm we enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch Service”
Reviews.Author: jonozamom
Reviews.Content: The staff is so on top of everything here, from parking your car to giving you a welcome phone message once you check in. Fresh baked cookies in the afternoon and complimentary breakfast - you just don't find this level of service anymore. It was such a breath of fresh air!

Reviews.Title: “This is a wonderful place for opera or symphony goers.”
Reviews.Author: labanduc
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at the Inn at the Opera to attend performances of the SF Opera. It was a delightful experience all around. This hotel is located literally steps from the Opera House and Symphony Hall. One can't ask for a better location from which to attend these functions. The hotel is very clean, tastefully furnished, quiet with a wonderfully comfortable bed. There was a breakfast included but we slept in too late so I can't say how the it was. I do know that all personnel are extremely friendly and helpful. We had absolutely no complaints about this hotel and will definitely stay there again and will recommend it to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay If You Own a Shell Timeshare”
Reviews.Author: FoxySanJoseCA
Reviews.Content: Unbeatable location for symphony and opera-goers. Many restaurant choices in the area. Small, but nice, clean rooms. Horrible service. Registration desk did not honor my prepaid reservation for a room at this hotel, claiming that no rooms were available. They very obligingly offered to pay my cab fare and for a free night's stay at another hotel across town. They apparently sold my room to someone else - I would guess that it was to a member of the Shell Vacation Club to which this hotel is associated. I stood my ground, and after I made enough of a ruckus, they gave me one of the rooms that claimed not to have. Amazing! Beware of making reservations here. You may arrive only to find them offering you taxi-fare to another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Old historic hotel, boutique feel”
Reviews.Author: SunnyNorCal
Reviews.Content: My mother booked two rooms for my husband and I and our two teenage kids through her Shell Vacation Club. The hotel was accomadating in giving us 2 rooms at the end of the hall and directly accross from one another. Decor was very nice and the room was clean. Bed was comfortable. Modern bathrooms plus fridge, micro, and kitchen sink and a few dishes. We were on the 7th floor - the view out front was so-so and looking at the emegency fire escape outside the window gave my daughter and I the creeps (I guess that is what you get in an old building.) Kind and helpful folks at the front desk. The continental breakfast was served in a lovely room (that doubles as their restaurant at night.) It was a little understaffed and they seemed to have trouble keeping everything replenished. Food was fair - hard boiled eggs, bagels, yogurt, fruit, coffee, juice and exactly the same both mornings. Parking is $28 per night, valet service, about par for most of SF.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a week long stay”
Reviews.Author: FestivaRep
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a timeshare exchange through Interval International the week of New Years, so it was a fantastic deal for the location and the quality of accommodations. Our one-bedroom unit was spacious (huge bathroom) with a kitchenette and living room area that made it comfortable for a longer stay. We had tickets to a concert at the Bill Graham Civic Auditorium and did not realize until we arrived that we were only a block away, so it's an ideal location for any events at the Opera House, Civic Auditorium, etc.

Reviews.Title: “On a scale of 1-10 it was an 11!”
Reviews.Author: funwunz
Reviews.Content: If you want service with a smile this is the place for you! We stayed 5 nights and found EVERY employee to be polite, professional, knowledgeable, helpful and willing to go the extra mile. From the housekeeper who stopped by just to be sure we had everything we needed, to the general manager who greeted us at the door, to the breakfast attendant who knew our eating patterns and provided refills without prompting, to the desk keeper who had hot, fresh cookies waiting for us, to the bellman who assisted us with directions, to the......you get the point.....EVERY employee enjoyed their job. It was a fantastic stay. If we are ever in the area we will choose Inn at the Opera again. It was right next to the breath taking city hall, within walking distance of the cable cars, near yummy food and right next to the opera house and ballet. Perfect in EVERY way!

Reviews.Title: “Our Anniversary at Inn at The Opera”
Reviews.Author: 2funlovers
Reviews.Content: We try to visit SF every year for our anniversary.We stayed at the Inn at the Opera this year which was very relaxing and enjoyable. Staff were very helpful and always very pleasant. We were in and out with our car many times during our stay and the car was always ready and waiting in front. We needed some information about the Opera, which was researched and sent to our room. The breakfast was very complete, with a very good presentation and tasty. We have already made reservations to return in Dec to see The Nutcracker with our grand daughter. We are so close to the Opera House we can walk. We would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to visit SF.

Reviews.Title: “Great location--easy access to the entire City”
Reviews.Author: SusanBG_10
Reviews.Content: Clean and comfortable, very pleasant staff, terrific breakfasts included with stay. Close to major public trransportation, easy access to the entire city. Don't miss the San Francisco Symphony, Ballet & Opera, all just around the corner from this hotel. Terrific restaurants within a short walk, too!

Reviews.Title: “We're coming back!”
Reviews.Author: dinersdivesdriveins
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for culture and easy access to all the touristy attractions, this hotel is located in an ideal spot. Easy access to public transportation, walking distance from hotel to local venues.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: Alanstours
Reviews.Content: A good choice for those that do not want to be in the middle of Union Square or tourist areas but not right out of town. It is a good hotel, very good front desk staff and convienient for most sights. Tour bus for the town stops outside (Grey Line) which is good - only issue being the tour bus you have to go the full route, can not get offand go back the way you came, it is a circular route. Minor issues with the hotel being the plumbing and restaurant - which is a franchise. Plumbing is a bit noisy when used, mainly the rooms next door so if you have an early riser next door a bit ofa pain. Restaurant/bar had a tendancy to close a bit early for us - 2100 last orders for food and drinks! Raised this with the management and believe they will solve the issue so may no longer be an issue. A good quality hotel, OK location and good staff.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for Opera Fans”
Reviews.Author: Deacjack
Reviews.Content: A fine restaurant at ground level - Opera House less than a block away. Excellant accomodations - Valet parking.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and hospitable staff”
Reviews.Author: tklempan
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a clean, comfortable, centrally located room in San Francisco, then the Inn at the Opera fits the bill. I stayed only one night but was thoroughly impressed from the minute I arrived. Rowena behind the desk was sincerely warm and welcoming and, since I'd arrived before the room was ready, gladly accepted my bags (which were spirited up to my room by the time I returned). Complimentary apples were a nice touch after a cross-country flight, and she was able to point out local points of interest easily. The central location, though, seems to be the best selling point. I was able to take BART in from SFO and walked easily to the hotel, and it provided an excellent reference point for a concert later that night, as well as trips to downtown and Yerba Buena Gardens. Being off the main streets was beneficial come bedtime, as there was little traffic noise to deal with. The only marks against the room were the lack of a dedicated or obvious air conditioner, which was not a real problem once I opened the window, and a toilet that didn't flush all the way every time. Overall, however, the Inn at the Opera was a great find and will be included in future trips to San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, would stay again”
Reviews.Author: jadamaxine
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised with Inn at the Opera. I was looking for a cheaper hotel and couldn't find anything between very expensive $200+ chains and the dumpy motels. I'll admit I didn't have high expectations for this hotel....and when we walked into the lobby, the hotel smelled old. But once we got up to the room, we were very impressed with the standard of cleanliness and spacious accomodations for the cheap price we paid (less than $120 a night). Our stay also included breakfast. I booked our stay on their website. The only draw back is that we wanted double beds but all the rooms have one queen. Parking was very convenient...just watch the posted frequent street cleaning times.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy, comfortable, and delightful”
Reviews.Author: sftheaterbuff
Reviews.Content: Great service, very nice rooms (although small). The little touches like the freshly baked cookies at the front desk, refrigerator in the room, bathrobes gave it that touch of class you expect at a boutique hotel in San Francisco. Great location close to Hayes Valley, opera & symphony halls, and SF Conservatory.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, charming, welcoming, clean, great value and safe”
Reviews.Author: uquan
Reviews.Content: This hotel made our stay in San Fran a great experience. The people who work there from the door man to the front desk to the cleaning crew and servers were just perfectly gracious and helpful and friendly. The artwork is beautiful and rooms clean and comfortable and well stocked. I loved that there were apples and cookies in a bowl everyday and the continental breakfast area was a great space to meet new people who were also vacationing with experiences and ideas to share. Outside of the hotel was clean and safe and plenty of street parking in the area...you just have to look for it and read the signs completely. We didn't have any problems and walked a few blocks to some really nice restaurants for dinner. The windows can be opened for fresh air which was great. And the view of the old capital right outside the door is breathtaking. Don't think twice about this hotel...they have a front desk person there around the clock and it is centrally located to everything but not crowded with tourism and is close to public transportation. We were very happy.

Reviews.Title: “Charming San Francisco Inn”
Reviews.Author: Sabrina_Hendsbee
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Inn at the Opera. It is a quaint, Victorian style hotel with excellent service! All of the staff were very helpful. A complimentary breakfast buffet was offered with our stay. It was very good -- much better than a typical "complimentary continental breakfast". My husband loved the coffee! Also, they have a cute little old-fashioned elevator that our little girls loved. Definitely recommend Inn at the Opera if you are looking for a cute little old-style, authentic feeling hotel in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Inn at the Opera is a charming, delightful boutique hotel.”
Reviews.Author: TucsonJean
Reviews.Content: Inn at the Opera is located right next to the Civic Center in downtown San Francisco. It is a mere 2 blocks from the Symphony Hall, the Opera Center, and the Ballet Institute. Bus stops are a 5-minute walk, and you can catch Bart (extremely easy getting to and from the airport!) only 10 minutes from this hotel. I would never choose to stay in the crowded, touristy Fisherman's Wharf area after having discovered this gem of a hotel. One of the best surprises about the Inn at the Opera was the sumptuous breakfast that was included in the price of the suite--bagels, toast, fresh fruit, eggs, cereal, cottage cheese, tomatoes, cream cheese, jams, strong coffee (!), and a lovely dining room where patrons could easily engage one another as well as the servers in conversation. Another treat was the friendliness of the front desk staff, notably "Dedes", who entertained us with amusing stories and charmed us with her gracious offers of help on all manner of inquiries. The Inn provides guests with computer access (so important these days to check email!) as well as a printer at no extra cost, and the front desk area was home to complimentary cookies and apples during the afternoon hours. The two suites we occupied (we booked last minute and had to change rooms) were immaculate and well-equiped with mini-refrigerator, microwave, coffee maker, sofa, flat-screen TV, plush towels, terry-cloth bathrobes, complimentary toiletries, and tasteful furnishings and window treatments throughout. The Inn at the Opera has the feel of old-world elegance from a time gone by, and we thoroughly and wholeheartedly recommend you indulge yourselves with a stay at the lovely Inn at the Opera, even if you don't plan to attend the opera!

Reviews.Title: “What a lovely boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: traveldivachica
Reviews.Content: As a Vaccination Shell Explorer member I had several points to use by the end of August. My boyfriend and I decide to go to San Francisco, stay in the City and not with family in the bay area. We wanted to explore the sounds and sites of San Fran, head out to Sausalito and Napa Valley. With this reservation The the Inn at the Opera was available. When I called to confirm my reservation, Javier answered the phone, I requested if possible for a great room, as best view as possible. He said he would try to do so and DID!! When we arrived to this Inn, the feeling of quaint, comfortable, classy and clean was all clear. The room was on the smaller size but so comfortable. With a small sitting room, queen size bed, clean shower/ tub bathroom, small kitchenette ( we only made coffee ) was so nice to have in our room. The ceiling fan, clean, soft sheets was great Complimentary continental breakfast in their regular size restaurant was so convenient for us. We loved the location, walking around the local restaurants, shops, parks, and sites. The beautiful City hall building just right down the street from us is such a beautiful place. San Francisco Ballet hall right around the corner, Symphony hall and Museums 5 minute walk away from the Inn was amazing. We had such a great experience, with great customer service and always willing to help. Thank you so much in making our experience even sweeter. I would totally come back to your facility, anytime. Sincerely, Dr. Yoeny Calas- Dobson- Veterinarian in Provo, Utah.

Reviews.Title: “From check-in to check-out absolutely wonderful!!!”
Reviews.Author: 3travelingamigos
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful group of people the staff at The Inn at The Opera was. The room was perfect. It was myself, husband and 13 yr. old daughter. Our suite had a separate bedroom w/ a queen bed and the sitting room had a queen sofa bed, a separate bathroom and a kitchenette. It was great having the kitchenette so we could keep drinks and some snacks in the fridge. As I said the staff was super. From the Bellman/Valets , the housekeeping staff to the Front Desk and the Management team, every single person was a jewel. i would stay here again in a heart beat.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for opera, classical music, ballet and the wonderful Hayes Valley neighborhood.”
Reviews.Author: annbb8
Reviews.Content: The staff was very friendly and helpful. I appreciated the personal greeting from the staff. The breakfasts are wonderful. I really liked that our room had a small kitchen. It was very easy retrieving our car from the hotel valet any time of the day or night. I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem”
Reviews.Author: pamandbobrothwell
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at this hotel. The staff were professional, friendly and very helpful. The atmosphere was relaxing, the breakfasts delicious. The Inn is very well maintained and well situated in the city (city hall is less than a block). We definitely would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A great Inn at a great location”
Reviews.Author: greybuffalo
Reviews.Content: I found the Inn at the Opera to be an excellant place to stay in San Francisco. Its location in the civic center and arts quarter is also central to anything else you would want to visit in San Fran. We had one of the "Ballet" (hotel room) units which was very comfortable for us. The staff was exceptionally helpful and courteous. I would recommend this classic hotel to anyone wanting to visit San Francisco and particularly those interested in the "feel" fo the city as well

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: easymoney113
Reviews.Content: We have stayed twice at the Inn. Our reservations were made on line with Shell Vacations Club. The staff greeted us warmly and politely. Both times our room was ready and the lights and fans were on as was the radio. We had suites that had all the necessary amenities including refrigerator, dishes, coffee maker, iron, hair dryer, etc. Everything worked. The beds were comfortable. A very satisfactory breakfast was included. The Inn was within easy walking distance of Market street where we were to see Wicked the play. Also we stayed for our nephews Masters recital at the San Francisco Conservatory of Music. City Hall is a block away. The Inn was very convenient for our needs and was clean and comfortable. There are lots of reasonably priced restaurants in the area. The staff was very accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “This quaint, charming hotel also has great service.”
Reviews.Author: mb65
Reviews.Content: The rooms were clean, and unique. We loved that it was a small hotel with the feel of a bed and breakfast. The staff went above and beyond to make us feel welcome. They answered all questions and fulfilled all requests promptly and pleasantly.

Reviews.Title: “1st time at this resort.”
Reviews.Author: bsilly
Reviews.Content: First time at the Inn at the Opera and I was very satisfied. The staff was wonderful. The atmosphere was also nice. The complimentary breakfast was great. Location was awesome. With the San Francisco MUNI system no need for a vehicle. Take a Super Shuttle to and From the airport, get the San Francisco Pass and have a blast. Would stay here again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised, Great value!!!!”
Reviews.Author: prd123
Reviews.Content: We recently spent a week here, booked through Interval International. The rooms were quite comfortable, the staff was marvelous, very helpful and attentive to all our questions. The Inn is a block away from some great restaurants in the Hayes District. We walked to get the cable car on Powell, walked to Sears for breakfast, walked to Chinatown, walked to AT&T Park. The only negative is that it does seem to get a little noisey out on the streets at night, with sirens, garbage pickup and street cleaning, but no more than any other downtown hotel. This will be our place to stay for future trips to San Fran.

Reviews.Title: “Accommodations were great and the staff was outstanding !!”
Reviews.Author: BillyC30
Reviews.Content: I was very impressed with the attentiveness of the entire staff from housekeeping, the front desk, valet guys, and the dining room personnel. Everyone was very pleasant to deal which made our stay much more enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stage for a San Francisco exploration!”
Reviews.Author: LosJohnson
Reviews.Content: Eventhough Opera was not on our to do list, the Inn At the Opera was a great place to stage our SF vacation from - lots of old school charm and flavor, conveniently located (especially if doing the symphony or opera), and a very friendly helpful staff. My wife and I found the rooms to be quite ample (which was one of our concerns after reading some reviews), with all the amenities. We stayed in their basic room (I believe they called it the 'ballet') which was very roomy for a vintage hotel, even had a little sink/fridge/coffee machine with good coffee. The floors were a little creaky and soft in spots, but it reminded you that you were in a vintage hotel, eventhough it was clean and 'modern'.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is a gem -- comfortable, convenient, with the friendliest staff imaginable.”
Reviews.Author: pbutten
Reviews.Content: I was visiting San Francisco to attend a concert of the SFSO and The Inn at the Opera was recommended to me as being convenient. It was that, and much more. The room -- a suite really -- was enormous, comfortable, and very reasonably priced. The complimentary breakfast was just right. Most of all, the staff were friendly, warm, and very helpful, with tips on how to get around SF by public transport, local restaurants -- all the extras. It has become the place I will always stay on my return visits to San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “This is a great place to stay in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: mcyerg
Reviews.Content: Inn at the Opera has a superb location - nearby public transportation, civic center, city hall, central library, Asian Art Museum, and lots of theatres. The hotel has old-world charm, the rooms are great, the staff is very friendly and helpful, the breakfasts are complimentary, everything you want for a nice vacation. I stayed a week this year and a week last year, and will stay there again whenever I can.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Boutique in the Midst of Hip”
Reviews.Author: OrangeMath
Reviews.Content: Next to Civic Center and the wonderful Hayes Valley district, the Inn welcomed us with smiles, free breakfasts, and a quiet room. Yes, the armoire was a bit close to the plush bed, but everything else was perfect - including free Internet access. This block of Fulton has little traffic, but walk a block or two and life abounds. Walk Gough and then double-back by way of Octavia. You'll have a real San Francisco experience. Want to see more of SF? Walk one block to Van Ness, hop any bus, pay $2 for 4 hours of touring. Each time we've stayed, we've parked for free on the street and walked two blocks. Beware of tickets ($60). Read the signs! Not many free spaces. Use the valet.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Wonderful People, Easy Walking to Everywhere”
Reviews.Author: gr8aspirations
Reviews.Content: The Inn at the Opera is a cozy hotel, offering wonderful service and close proximity to music, plays, museum and other parts of San Francisco. The Inn at the Opera offers free wireless service which actually worked and was free as it stated. Wireless was available in the rooms as well as the cozy intimate receiving areas. Its small size, gives you the feel of luxury and ease of a Bed and Breakfast, but its service iss that of a larger hotel. With the in house continental breakfast, the closeness of the Italian restaurant, and the afternoon cookies, this is a hotel , i will continue to frequent. The Inn at the Opera is a Shell Vacation participant, however, there was no sales pitch nor any difference between the Shell members and regular guests. With the in room coffee, refrigerator, microwave and sink, it made leftovers easy to handle after large meals. The comfortable queen sized bed felt like clouds and the morning view of the city and breezes was worth the trip. There are in spa services as well as easy access to other services. The Inn at the Opera is located in the middle of San Francisco, less than 1 miles from Union Square, 1 mile from the Presido and Golden Gate Park, this was a nice change of pace from the boisterous fare of Fisherman's Wharf.

Reviews.Title: “Not Just For The Opera!”
Reviews.Author: JM144
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really in a great location for a great price if you don't want to be right downtown. It's a fairly quiet street and within decent walking distance of so many attractions. It is also a few blocks to Hayes Valley where there are lots of restaurants and bars and cafes. We traveled with a young couple from New Zealand and their 14 month old baby. We had a great room with an window that opens (very important to us) and the usual mini fridge, sink, microwave, dishes etc., that are offered by Shell Hospitality hotels. Our friends nailed a suite for a great price, so we were able to eat in the room for dinner and put the baby down at her normal bed time. Got great Mexican take out from a few blocks away. The hotel is really like a homey B&B. The continental breakfast was just perfect. Toast, hard boiled eggs, cereal, fruit, muffins, juice and coffee. All very good. Rooms were quiet and staff was pitch perfect. Will use this as our new base (if we can get in) from now on. Otherwise, we'll stay at their sister hotel The Donatello near Union Sq.

Reviews.Title: “A small, charming, downtown hotel near performance venues”
Reviews.Author: Calico1990
Reviews.Content: Quiet and comfortable rooms, excellent service, walking distance to good choice of restaurants and shops, and practically next door to the opera, orchestra, & ballet.

Reviews.Title: “Going to the opera in San Francisco? Stay here!”
Reviews.Author: giorgioso
Reviews.Content: This boutique hotel is one block from the San Francisco Opera. We've stayed here several times. Great breakfasts, superlative staff. Rooms are all suites with complete amenities, including wi-fi. The ambience is wonderful. We felt we were in a small hotel in one of the great cities of Europe.

Reviews.Title: “Everything I want in a hotel stay”
Reviews.Author: CountryGrrrl
Reviews.Content: I live on the California coast about 4 hours drive from San Francisco, and frequently go there to attend opera, ballet or theatrical performances, as well as to visit friends. The Inn at the Opera is one of the choices available to me through my time share ownership, and I always make it my first choice when going to the city. It's a smaller property, which creates a feeling of cozy intimacy. If I'm going to the opera, symphony or ballet, it's a perfect location--just cross the street and I'm there. Staff are unfailingly courteous, knowledgeable and welcoming. Breakfast is provided and, while not extensive, has everything I want to get my day started right. Valet parking is available for an additional daily fee, but with unlimited in and out privileges, it's well worth it. There's only one small elevator, so if many people are checking in or out at the same time you might experience a delay. I'm always happy to make this my 'home' in the city.

Reviews.Title: “one of my best experiences”
Reviews.Author: davekessler
Reviews.Content: the hotel personnel were very pleasent and helpful with my parents and family. they went out of there way to make sure our stay was the best.

Reviews.Title: “A solid "9" out of a possible "10"”
Reviews.Author: HarryEncinitas_CA
Reviews.Content: We reserved a Symphony Suite (pics attached) for three nights to attend the opera - just 1/2 block away! Delightful old hotel - built in 1927 - which has been recently refurbished. Rooms were decently sized with a HUGE bathroom and all of the usual amenities - including wifi ! The staff are absolutely among the nicest, most caring and friendly I have ever encountered in worldly travels. And the dinner downstairs was a pure delight in a totally warm, congenial and upscale atmosphere ... with call-gin martinis at only $9.00 with a generous pour! Nice! VERY Nice.! A tad out of the way but with public transport near enough during the day - but its closeness to the Opera House is the real 'treat' .... you can be 'in bed' just 15 minutes after the last curtain! Nice.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfully staffed, service oriented Inn, Great food & location, WOW”
Reviews.Author: timmyd778
Reviews.Content: My lady & I found The Inn to be just what we were looking for, clean, quiet, centrally located with a wonderful restaurant on site. We found All of the staff very cooperative and helpful, as this was our 1st trip to San Francisco and we had many questions. The front desk staff gave us assistance with public transportation information and what to see and how to get there using the Muni, Cable cars & sightseeing transportation. From the Bellman to the breakfast staff and the cleaning personel, we want to offer our cudo's for a "job well done". Our room was more than adequate, clean and bright, with a bonus refrigerator & microwave and a comfortable bed.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint & well located”
Reviews.Author: patandcolin1
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, situated in the heart of the theatre district. We were only a block away from the Davis Symphony Hall for the show we were attending. Lots of restaurants & cafes close by. The hotel staff were amazing, the room smaller but very comfortable and charming. There was an excellent continental breakfast included. The hotel has a beautiful dining room. We will definitely stay at Inn at the Opera again.

Reviews.Title: “A gem of a hotel located in the heart of the performing arts district of San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: travelerformusic
Reviews.Content: The front desk staff went above and beyond the call of duty to assist me.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, Intimate & Elegance”
Reviews.Author: JBGarcia
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay here. A very quiet, intimate stay. The service is very friendly and helpful. The complimentary breakfast excellent and elegant. The servers very attentive and the other guests very friendly. The decor elegant as if spending a night at the opera. The elevator a trip into the past. No personal parking but the attendants are very efficient in getting your car when you need it and very trustworthy not to take any of your belongings. A beautiful view of City Hall but the surrounding buildings were under major construction. Still a great place to stay, We did not get a chance to have dinner there but I'm sure it would be as wonderful as everything else.

Reviews.Title: “tiny room, good service”
Reviews.Author: nyctravelguy7
Reviews.Content: room was really tiny and perhaps best for one guest only. not good for two. we managed to move around the room with not much room to spare. you almost had to be a ballerina to be in their "ballet" room! room was in the back with views of white walls. seemed bad at first but turned out to be a quiet room. good service. seems like everyone is programmed to be super nice to make up for room size. continental breakfast was good. would recommend to a friend who's on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Best Service I've Ever Had !!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: travelchick55
Reviews.Content: I've been traveling over 30 yrs and in all my trips I've never ever met a staff as good as this. Everyone was wonderful, from the front desk, to the bellhops to the maids, etc. It was always a cheerful Good Morning or Welcome Back. etc. The units were spotless as was the lobby & dining room. This is a perfect place if you are attending the "arts". Symphony, ballet, opera, etc. The only downside was the rooms were smaller than I am used to. I timeshare and are used to much bigger rooms so I would not recommend this for a family but for a romantic getaway or husband/spouse it would be perfect. . Leslie

Reviews.Title: “Too Noisy to Sleep”
Reviews.Author: margfong
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on weekend where an outdoors concert going on past 1 am in the morning. Management did not tell us about it and when asked earlier in the evening they said it would be done before midnight. The previous night was alright, so just make sure you do not stay here on one of these nights if you prefer quietness.

Reviews.Title: “Great Surprise”
Reviews.Author: MateoVelasquez
Reviews.Content: My job requires that I travel a lot. In April of 2010 I was out 13 nights, 7 different cities and 7 different hotels. We have someone that makes our hotel reservations for us and I did not know what to expect. I had a little trouble finding the hotel, but it was well worth the effort. I understand that the Inn at the Opera was built in 1929 but it has been beautifully renovated. The rooms are very comfortable and clean. I had a very pleasant stay and that staff was extremely helpful and went out of their way to give you what you needed, and to make sure you stay was memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Superior Service”
Reviews.Author: Cheskabrit
Reviews.Content: I spent a delightful week at the Inn at the Opera in early May. From the minute I arrived, I felt welcomed! Warm cookies were on the counter at the desk, a bucket of ice was supplied (as it was each day when I returned from sightseeing) and I was directed to neighborhood amenities within minutes of my arrival. The customer service star from that day forward was Rowena who anticipated my every need and treated me like royalty. When I overflowed the tub, fresh towels were at my door within minutes. When I was too tired to go out, I got take out and room service menus. And after arranging my airport shuttle for my early morning departure, she made a point to say goodbye since she would not be on duty when I left. How sweet is that! The rooms are spacious and comfortable. Huge baths have plush robes and there is a small but functional kitchenette with place settings for four. The mini-fridge was perfect for keeping my ferry market purchases and chilling wine. My room had only two windows, but plenty of lighting. I did hear some sirens (a fire station is nearby) but otherwise the room was quiet. Being in a metro area, I would expect some street noise like this. Although I travel with a noise cancelling device, I never had to use it here. The location is fairly convenient to public transport with a main line 2 blocks away on Van Ness and another about 5 blocks away on Market. Cabs are available by phone (which the front desk staff happily arrange) and arrive within 10 minutes or so. They have free internet and a computer near the lobby with a printer for boarding passes, maps, etc. Not exactly a business center, but adequate and accessible 24/7. Not much to do/see in the immediate area except the Opera/Ballet which I did attend. Everything else is a 10-20 minute cab ride or tram away. I paid about $10 per trip for taxis and the three day transport pass for the rest was $18 and available for purchase at the city hall 1 Â½ blocks away. The staff made me a map my first day showing me where to go and how to get there. The breakfast (included) is continental and you can eat in the dining room, take a tray to your room or have it delivered. One couple was arguing in the elevator about having to get up and go downstairs and I told them they could have had their meal delivered. They really liked that and did not know it was an option. The buffet includes hard boiled eggs, bagels, muffins, cut up fruit, tomato slices (an odd addition?), cold cereal, milk, coffee, orange juice. Some breakfast meat and cheese would be a nice option as well as more juice choices â€“ maybe not every day, but in rotation. Apples were always available in a bowl on the sideboard by the elevator and fresh cookies were made every day at 3:00. I did not eat in the restaurant during my stay. It can be busy on Opera/Ballet nights until after 8:00. I did, however, order room service one evening and it was delicious. The meat was done as ordered and sides were good and hot. I liked the elegant dÃ©cor and appreciated the attentive and personal service. I would highly recommend a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Well situated, comfortable hotel with friendly, helpful staff and fine dining on site.”
Reviews.Author: Meg69
Reviews.Content: All of San Francisco's attractions and neighbourhoods are easily accessed from this quiet neighborhood. Pleasant and helpful staff. Comfortable, attractive accomodations

Reviews.Title: “Great value, plenty of charm”
Reviews.Author: DanSeattle
Reviews.Content: My room was clean, comfortable, and nicely decorated. Staff was quite friendly. It was a great value, though watch out for the expensive parking. With tax it was about $28/night. Otherwise, an excellent value. I'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Spring Break: food, walking tour & excellent hotel - but leave your car out of the city.”
Reviews.Author: eticket221
Reviews.Content: One of the best, courteous staff we have encountered at Inn At The Opera. From the time you walk in for check in, to each time you walk past the registration table, you are greeted so warmly; this made any shortcomings about the stay invisible - and the shortcomings are few. Located just a mile or two from any tourist or hot spot in San Fransisco, you can walk, take the Bart or bus anywhere. Rooms very comfortable with a microwave & refrigerator; a nice complementary breakfast each morning. My only deters from this hotel is parking with a $25. charge plus 14% tax for valet/overnight and the overnight emergency vehicle sirens that goes off being in a major city where everything is compact. If the parking cost is an issue, there is an EZ parking on Jones Street however this is NOT recommended for everyone as you walk through some of the darker parts of town just to get to and from your car. Outside the complementary breakfast, any other meals can be found from places like Whole Foods or Bristol Farms (located in San Francisco Center) to well known restaurants like California Pizza Kitchen (a block away). If you are into exotic, regional or ethnic foods, San Francisco has that too: Chinese, Japanese, Organic, Turkish and the Farmer's Market, just to name a few. Some of our favorites are the Plant, The Cafe Gratitude (featured in Jason Mraz's song "Make It Mine"), and the famous sourdough clam chowder on pier 39. Mill Valley is 30 minutes away features Food Network's Tyler Florence's cooking store in a quaint walking town; a couple of other notable stores: Phat Burger and Tea Fountain. Palo Alto/Mountain View is approximately 45 minutes away (no toll to come and go) where you can visit Stanford and a great Dim Sum restaurant. Many of the links are listed below. Enjoy! http://www.shellhospitality.com/hotels/inn_at_the_opera/?chebs=gl_innatopera http://ezpublicparking.com/ http://www.wholefoodsmarket.com/ http://www.bristolfarms.com/home.html http://westfield.com/sanfrancisco/ http://www.karascupcakes.com/index2.html http://www.theplantcafe.com/ http://www.cafegratitude.com/cafe http://www.chowderspier39.com/ http://www.tylerflorence.com/ http://www.pearlsdiner.com/ http://www.teafountain.com/ http://www.yelp.com/biz/fu-lam-mum-mountain-view#hrid:P5ZMh7xhCnb8xndy261B6A

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and great location BUT caveat emptor!”
Reviews.Author: dakineklein
Reviews.Content: I used to own a SF deli back in the '80s and went to the opera frequently; I stayed at the IATO several times and loved it, very fond memories of the piano bar, ambiance, and rooms. When I was planning a two-day museum trip in the city, I check out Trip Advisor and read several warnings regarding the management and their tendency to change up the reservations. With this warning in mind, I booked an Opera Suite Room and emailed the manager to obtain, in writing, confirmation that I had booked and reserved said Opera Suite. Confirmation promptly arrived by email. When we arrived, we met with the following: "Hmm, I don't see your booking for the Opera Suite. I will call Javier (the same person who confirmed the booking by email) for further direction...please have a seat in the lobby." After 10 min. of lobby simmering, I asked what she was authorized to do to accommodate us, as clearly, there was a problem that was not being solved. She offered us the Symphony Suite with complimentary parking. We accepted, as we had dinner plans in an hour, went to our room, took showers and then the same desk clerk showed up at the door to announce that Javier said we could either move to an Opera Suite (that miraculously had become available) or continue with our present arrangements with complimentary parking. We stayed put as we had to leave for dinner and were in robes. Argh! On the positive side: very quiet, great central location, excellent parking valet services, and everybody was very polite. It seems that the IATO, both a hotel and a time-share, has ongoing issues with ensuring reservations. Perhaps the time-share owners' bookings take precedence over the standard reservations? Who knows, but I doubt that I would book again with confidence unless the room didn't matter.

Reviews.Title: “Not what it used to be - reservation not honored”
Reviews.Author: Philos99
Reviews.Content: We had made a reservation weeks ahead, and arrived at 5:30 pm, with a dinner reservation also in the hotel, and an 8:00 pm concert at nearby Herbst Theatre. We were told that no room was available due to "maintenance issues". The hotel appears to be under new management (Shell Vacations - are they operating it as a timeshare?), and the desk clerk was unapologetic, regarding a room at a sister hotel in another part of town as a perfect alternative, even though there was an annotation on our reservation (which she showed me) that one of our party was handicapped. Before posting any review, I called the manager and left voicemail on his personal line, but I have received no reply, so reluctantly have to file this report. Previously we had enjoyed staying at this hotel close to concert halls and opera, but in future we shall stay further away at a hotel we can trust. Unfortunately we had not read the TripAdvisor review of a similar occurrence the month before.

Reviews.Title: “The "Ballet" rooms are too small”
Reviews.Author: jim72150
Reviews.Content: Stayed here March 2010. We got what we thought was a great deal for the "Ballet Package" at $109 per night. The reality is that we should have told the staff that the room was just too small for our enjoyment and upgraded to a larger room (my own fault for cheaping out). Overall the place was clean and the staff was very helpful. We did not think that the location was as convenient for us as we would have liked. We were here in March and the temperature in the room was fine, however, there was no air conditioning in our room. This could be a problem in the warmer months. Bottom line is that we got what we paid for and I would not recommend booking a "Ballet" room. For an extra $50 per night, our stay would have been much more enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Charming European boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dutch45
Reviews.Content: From the moment we checked in, we were delighted with this hotel; it far surpassed our imagining. The staff members are capable, competent, well-informed and care about the guests. The decor is understated elegance accented with paintings and drawings featuring stringed instruments and scenes from operas. Our spacious Opera suite was perfect for the two of us; music was playing in the background since the radio was already tuned to a classical station. Beds are very comfortable and the suite was cleaned daily even though we were timeshare exchangers. Apples and freshly baked cookies greeted us every afternoon when we returned from exploring San Francisco neighborhoods. The complimentary Continental Plus breakfast is a great way to start the day. The ballet and symphony halls are one block away. We found the public transportation very convenient: bus stops are only half a block away and vintage streetcar, trolley car and BART stops are three blocks away. The cable cars are only a few blocks away by bus. 1- 3- or 7-day MUNI passes are economical and quickly more than pay for themselves. Also, this area of San Francisco is very flat so it's easy to walk around. Ovation restaurant right in the hotel serves delicious meals beautifully served in a lovely, romantic atmosphere. In the background is live gentle jazz. Other restaurants are nearby within easy walking distance, but we were so enchanted by Ovation that we didn't try them. The business center is minimal, but it does permit one to check email and surf the web and it is free. We will definitely return to Inn at the Opera when we are in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “A traveler's disaster”
Reviews.Author: Rearldavis
Reviews.Content: We made a reservation a month in advance for a romantic Valentine's weekend. When we arrived they told us they had no room for us. They acknowledged they had our phone number but had not called us. They said they had found us a room at a hotel withwhich we were familiar which was not acceptable. (It was in a a very unsafe part of town) Management was rude and uncaring. Our weekend was ruined . We will never attempt to stay there again nor at any of Shellgame (or whatever) Vacation partners nor will be patronize their restaurants. We will recommend against all of the above to all of our friends. Incidently, we visit San Francisco frequently but I am sure that is not of concern to them. They had the nerve to solicit this review!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: KimB6
Reviews.Content: Loved the hotel. Very classic. Very different. Staff was great. Lots of character.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint”
Reviews.Author: Regihaze
Reviews.Content: Such a cute hotel. This is not a place for a big family to stay, especially with kids!! a nice room, easy enough for 2 people no more! Super breakfast in the main restaurant. Even though the weather was just terrible there was a nice warm room to come back to. The location was fabulous right across from the Opera House and another music venue across from that. The Asain Art Museum is just beautiful!!! I could never get my internet up and going but, there is a nice coffee shop just around the corner that has it for free.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Our Experience - hotel is ideally located and the room was great”
Reviews.Author: marathon1962
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my mom and dad and had a GREAT experience. My parents are in their late 70's and we used public transportation with no problems whatsoever. The hotel is ideally located in the civic center with all the major bus stops just a few minutes away by foot. The room was beautifully decorated. I came along at the last minute and the hotel was happy to provide a roll-away bed at no extra charge. The concierge was very helpful with bus information. We had a splendid time!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: Ish88
Reviews.Content: This was our third time to stay at this charming hotel. Found all of the staff to be very friendly and most helpful to meet our needs. Especially loved having the concierge to help locate restaurants within walking distance; and find transportation to the Walt Disney museum at the Presidio. Though some may find it "a bit off the beaten path" we found many shops and restaurants that were located within a 10-15 minute walk. Will definitely plan to stay here on our next trip to San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Good Time”
Reviews.Author: jsfrantz
Reviews.Content: Overall good stay - Room 25 was very small and did not have the website advertised DVD or CD. Otherwise - very good: good location with street parking continental breakfast - cerial, toast and fruit was good and well served staff were great! area - civic center has no shopping and is pretty sleazy

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and restaurant--cool shower”
Reviews.Author: dudecko
Reviews.Content: Everything abouit this Inn is comfortable and convenient. The water for the shower could have been hotter. But other than that, it's a great little place and the price you can't beat for the location. I would stay again and hopefully the shower water will be hotter.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing to recommend it except convenient to City Hall, courts, opera”
Reviews.Author: SanJoseKitty
Reviews.Content: When I checked in, I walked to the front desk and waited. Nobody responded. "Hello?" I called out. Movement from the back, then a person came out, saying nothing. I said "checking in" and gave my name. Still without any response or greeting, the person shuffled the reservation list until she found my name. It was not a good start. Then she told me the hotel parking lot was full, so I could not valet park. She told me to drive one block and then left one block, couldn't miss the parking lot. I asked if there was an attendant, because it was night, and dark. No, she said, you just swipe your credit card. I followed her directions, parked, and found the kiosk to pay. It dd not take credit cards. It was hard to read the sign in the dark, which said if you want to use credit cards you have to pay across the street. The hotel should have told me that. It's not the best area to be running around after dark, waving cash or a credit card. Room was okay, nothing special, somewhat rundown. I had three lumpy puffy pillows, which made my neck crook at a funny angle. I called the front desk and asked for a flat pillow. "Flat? You mean deflated old pillows? No, we don't have any of those." In the morning, the hot water was not very hot. Breakfast was continental only, which was a disappointment, because I had a long day ahead of me and wanted some scrambled eggs. Bad cheesy christmas music was playing too loudly in the breakfast room. It's right next to City Hall, the opera house, Davies Hall, and state government buildings, so the location is good if that's why you are there. Otherwise, give me the Hotel Rex or Adagio downtown any day.

Reviews.Title: “COZY AND RELAXING WEEK-END”
Reviews.Author: nana100
Reviews.Content: The Inn At The Opera stay was very nice. From the minute we entered the Hotel the entire staff treated us very nice and they were all very friendly . The room was very clean and cozy.We will stay there again and tell our family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “A Comfortable European Style Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JohnCavalli
Reviews.Content: We stay at the Inn every month for a 3-day 2-night getaway. We are always completely satisfied with our stay. The Inn has a European feel to it. Comfortable and cozy. They have a wonderful FREE breakfast -- the usual continental stuff plus hard boiled eggs. The staff is very friendly and helpful. We always look forward to our monthly getaway. The Inn at the Opera makes it all the more enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Charming and relaxed.”
Reviews.Author: SurferGirl92648
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful stay at the Inn at the Opera! Located across from City Hall and a nice walk to Union Square. The decor was charming and quaint, yet updated and classy. Service was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE the Inn at the Opera!”
Reviews.Author: Gypsiescollect
Reviews.Content: We recently spent a few nights at the perfectly situated Inn At The Opera in San Francisco. It is a small hotel right across the street from the stage door at the gorgeous San Francisco Opera. Just a short walk from wonderful restaurants and shops, is is a great location to stay in San Francisco. We rented a car this time, determined to figure out the driving, and being right in the Civic Center made it so easy to get around. Tiny lobby, big hearted staff, we loved the guy who parked our car and took care of us, the delightful concierge who printed out a huge list of vintage shops for me and the woman who made up for the tiny rooms we too big people complained about... We are looking for our next trip there, to catch the music, the vitality and most of all, the joy of Inn At the Opera. It was fun...and we are two older, somewhat handicapped seasoned travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great stay”
Reviews.Author: DenverYosemite_Sam
Reviews.Content: The staff was very friendly and accomadating. The hotel is a bit worn but very clean and charming. Rooms are a bit small, but adequit. The location is outstanding if you are in San Francisco for a performance or in Hays Valley for other reasons.

Reviews.Title: “Thank You!”
Reviews.Author: felmax
Reviews.Content: The email we sent (today) to Javier Hernandez, the Inn at the Opera's manager, regarding our recent visit: Good Morning Javier, We just completed a 9 day stay at your property (room 77) and want to express our thanks and gratitude for the wonderful customer service from your staff. When we arrived on Saturday, Nov 7, the Ballet room that Romeo had confirmed us in was not yet available so we had room 28 for the night. The next day we were relocated to room 77 and, while we were out, all our belongings were moved up to that room. We want to say an extra special thank you to Betty from Housekeeping. She was wonderful on Saturday & Sunday when we arrived and transitioned to our new room. Throughout our stay she would always stop by and say hello while we were having breakfast. You are fortunate to have such a friendly and helpful person on your staff. The front desk staff went out of their way to make us feel welcome and always addressed us by name, adding a very personal touch. It is rare these days to experience such consistent customer service and obviously Inn at the Opera is getting it right! Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: cdnwalker
Reviews.Content: The service was excellent at this hotel: staff very helpful and extremely friendly. Room was a bit on the smaller side but considering the location and the very reasonable price for downtown it was completely acceptable! Breakfast buffet included fresh fruit and good "continental" assortment.

Reviews.Title: “They know how to take the reservation, they just do not know how to hold it”
Reviews.Author: alexSoCal
Reviews.Content: I reserved a 3 room 498 square feet suite through Orbitz. I was offered a 2 room 292 square feet suite. The suite was too small for our family of four and we did not check-in. The staff of the Inn at the Opera told us that the smaller suite is almost as good as the one we reserved. They did not apologize and blamed Orbitz/overbooking for the error. They said that I should call Orbitz (they did not have the number, I did not have it either). They did not help me search for another hotel and they promised to charge a cancellation fee. I sat in the lobby of the Inn at the Opera and searched for another hotel. I found another place, put my kids and the the luggage in the car and drove away.

Reviews.Title: “Inn At the Opera is our newest favorite getaway!”
Reviews.Author: gbrownhigh73
Reviews.Content: Some of the friendliest hotel staff will be found here! We've stayed twice and have truly enjoyed both stays. Breakfast was always plentiful and again, service always with a smile. I suggest parking the car in the valet lot & walk or use rapid transit in the city. The location is perfect for seeing the beautiful city hall (pretty much just across the street) as well as the War Memorial Auditorium & Opera House. Inn at the Opera is an easy walking distance from the Asian Art Museum (great Samurai exhibit along with an entire day's worth of other artifacts), United Nations building (neat fountain), nice little park with playground area for kids (adults must be accompanied by a child to enter!), and easy access to trolley, bus, or cable cars. We'll definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Quaint Elegance combined w/ personal service, healthy breakfast, apples, cookies & smiles”
Reviews.Author: arlene246
Reviews.Content: We stay at "The Inn at the Opera" every time we go to San Francisco. The staff knows us by name but they give personal name recognition & attentive service to everyone - they bend over backwards to make sure your stay is relaxing & worry-free. On our last stay we arrived @ 9am w/ our friends after taking the red-eye from Hawaii - the staff was so accommodating in letting us eat breakfast while they rushed to get a room ready for early check-in! Then when we were departing for a 6am flight & the limousine service didn't arrive as scheduled, the staff managed to find & call the driver at home, clarified that he was suppose to be here @ 4am not 4pm (schedule mix-up) & able to get everyone to the airport on time! We love going to San Francisco because we love staying here!

Reviews.Title: “Four Fabulous Days in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: Specialstays
Reviews.Content: Inn At The Opera is a lovely hotel with caring ,efficient staff members, a wonderful restaurant, and an amazing location! The Symphony Hall is close by as are many shops and restaurants. The classical music playing, the lovely decor and the happy atmosphere made this one of my favorite places! I have traveled all over the world (mostly on a limited budget) and this is one hotel I really want to return to again and again! Some places just have a special magic about them and this is one!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay except for Van broken in”
Reviews.Author: dagkim
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed here from 6/22-6/26. Staff is excellent, accomodations clean and adequate , daily breakfast filling and everything was excellent unti 4th day when we were about to leave for a tour when we found our van broken in. Prevous night my hubby decide to park van along McAllister (across City Hall) and left GPS stand in the van. A bum/thief smashed front passenger's window and stole stuff in our van. Hubby spent $300 to fix window and we lost a day of touring as we need the van to get around and waited for it to get fixed. Hotel staff said that more incidents like this are happening lately.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for the Opera!”
Reviews.Author: OperabuffCarmel_Ca_
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at this hotel before & it is very convenient for the opera. It's about 1 1/2 miles from Union Square. It is an older hotel, more like a residence. The rooms can be small, but the suites are roomy & good value for the money. Only 1 small elevator for the 7 floors. The rooms could do with lighter color decor, but I think they are working on some upgrades, as some rooms have new flat screen TVs. No airconditioning in the rooms, only fans, but this is usually not a problem in San Francisco's cool climate even in summer. Great restaurant on the fine dining side. Complimentary Continental Breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “The location can't be beat for this part of the city.”
Reviews.Author: dskid
Reviews.Content: If you want to be away from the city center, have business at city hall or are going to an event at one of the theaters or auditoriums near by, this is certainly the hotel to pick. We stayed in one of the suites that I believe is called an Opera Room. It had two full baths and is a perfect accomodation for three persons. It felt very roomy and was designed for maximum privacy. The elevator is small (4 persons) and very slow, so if you're on one of the upper floors be prepared to wait. The room does not have a safe. I was originally going to write that the room was a little tired and needed a makeover but looking closer I saw that it had recently had one and it was just the color scheme that made it look that way. There were two TV's but they were just 19" CRT's and the one in the bedroom didn't swivel far enough to make it fully face the head of the bed. Heating is by two oil filled radiators on wheels like the kind one can buy at Home Depot. While the room was generally quiet I could plainly hear the shower on the upper floor. About 50% of the time the toilet next to the bedroom wouldn't fill after a flush and I had to remove the tank top and get it unstuck. Also, I noticed that the pipes to the sink and toilet still had the tags on them from the hardware store. I like to see a little more attention to detail than this. The price was certainly reasonable for the room size. The staff at the front desk were extremely friendly and helpful. The continental breakfast was very adequate and filling.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay- Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Kayla_Phoenix
Reviews.Content: I was a guest at the Inn May 22-26, 2009. It was more than I had hoped for. The staff is very attentive, friendly and accommodating and was able to answer all my questions, including personal opinions. This is an older hotel so keep in mind, the elevator is small for more than 2 people with luggage, especially we claustrophobic ones. The running water can be loud at times, but it is always hot and good pressure. The courtesy apples and cookies are a welcoming treat when returning from long days out and about. I was cautioned about walking alone in the area, but I always felt safe and took advantage of the local buses rather than taxis to get around. The restaurant Ovations is FABULOUS. Lillian was hostess, bartender, waiter, cashier, and I wouldn't be surprised if she helped wash the dishes. All with a smile and the best service. Jin at the front desk helped me numerous times, as well as the other FD staff and bell staff, who unfortunately I did not remember their names. The Concierges are eager to have you attend the "owners update", but a simple no and the conversation is over. Close to City Hall, the opera houses, fine and casual dining, easy access to Union Square and down to the bayshore, and so much more. If you seek a quaint hotel with excellent services, please take the opportunity to check out the Inn at the Opera. I'll be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not my favorite”
Reviews.Author: JPeck90673
Reviews.Content: I booked this room through Hotwire, and will avoid picking this part of town again (Hayes Valley/Civic Center) in an effort to avoid this hotel. I am a frequent traveler to San Francisco, and understand the concept of small rooms here, whether they market it as "boutique hotel" or "european style". I can honestly say this is the smallest room I have ever stayed in. My view of the fire escape doesn't help. Total claustrophobic hotel, with poor service. Not a great location to walk to things to (except Civic Center and Opera House), and poor service in bar/restaurant. They seem to run on their own hours, with no consistency. Not sure how Hotwire rates it a 3.5 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Service”
Reviews.Author: MontrealMaria52
Reviews.Content: If you are thinking about coming to San Francisco consider the Inn at the Opera. The staff could not do enough to make my stay one I shall remember for a long time. Shiela, the concierge took care of any questions about tours, places to see, getting around town etc. while the front reception staff were always there to nurture and take care of any needs. Breakfast was more than just a continental with plenty of choices. Location of Inn at the Opera was great - in a safe neighborhood in the Civic Centre district but not hours away from the centre of town or Fisherman's Wharf. Best tour recommended is the Movie Tour. What a treat to learn about the 600 Hollywood films shot in San Francisco and learn about the city at the same time. Worth every penny. Only advice to Inn at the Opera is to get CNN on their TV system rather than that horrid Fox News channel. Providing free internet for guests in the lobby would also enhance the services provided. Had I known about the free internet services available in my room, I would have brought my laptop. Overall my experience at Inn at the Opera was exceptional. First class.

Reviews.Title: “Worse suite experience in a "resort" by Shell Hospitality despite good location”
Reviews.Author: Hotelsurffer
Reviews.Content: As I was searching a hotel to stay for a weekend visit back to San Francisco, I came cross to this hotel which is managed by Shell Hospitality and considered as a "resort" in the company's standard. It is an all suite property right off Civic Center, War Memorial Opera House and Symphony Hall in the posh Hayes Valley area. Welcome area and lounge area are decorated in classic tone and completely charming boutique feel from the beginning of the boutique hotel booms in the industry. The first staff I encountered at Front Desk was not uniformed when I arrived at a quarter past 1PM (a bit early for check-in but it was Sunday and the city is running lower occupancy in hotel industry, so I thought I could give it a try). Of course, the room/suite was not ready. I stored my belongings with the hotel and off my errands in the city. I was told that the room would be ready by 3PM. I returned to the hotel around 3:30PM and was given room 35 after 10 minutes wait by the Front Desk to get someone to acknowledge me. I got the key within one minute and off I went to the classic SF apartment cozy elevator.
